description:
Went here with my boyfriend for brunch on a Sunday morning, and was really impressed that we didn't have to wait at all to be seated. They have a nice outdoor seating area, which was perfect for the good weather that day. 

The two of us shared a Skinnylicious Sangria, which tasted good, but was 3/4 ice! It would have been great to have a little more of the actual drink, especially since the ice melted so quick and then just made it all so watery. The bigger disappointment however, came when we saw the check. That tiny glass cost $13. The price was not written on the menu, but we didn't bother asking since neither of us expected it to cost that much!

As for the food, my boyfriend had the Chicken Madeira since that's always our go-to. A stellar dish as a whole, but his mashed potatoes were really lumpy with huge chunks of potato that were not mashed at all! I ordered a side of mashed potatoes for myself, which were just perfect, and just had a bunch of their whole wheat bread! Its undoubtedly the best bread I've every had, and it was what I went there for that morning. I asked for extra after finishing what they first put on your table. Its so good, I even went there the next morning, bought a whole warm baguette from their bakery, and finished the entire thing as breakfast!
author: Haylee M.

description:
I went here with my boyfriend on a Saturday for dinner. It was crowded and had a long wait, but this place usually has a long wait for dinner.

This restaurant is at the very top of Macy's at Union Square and has both indoor and outdoor seating. If you choose to sit outside, you get to enjoy the nice view of Union Square without getting too cold because there are heat lamps. We chose to sit inside.

Once seated, you're given a bread basket with 2 kinds of bread. I don't know what type of breads they are, but one of them was a brown bread roll and the other was a white bread roll. Both breads tasted good and are complimentary too!

We ordered Factory Nachos, Spaghetti and Meatballs, and the Steak Diane with Herb Crusted Salmon. We both thought the Factory Nachos were very good and they give you a big portion too! We had to try to stop ourselves from finishing it because we wanted to make space for our entrees.

I chose the spaghetti and I thought it was good, but not the best spaghetti I've ever had. My boyfriend chose the Steak Diane with Herb Crusted Salmon and he liked it a lot! His dish came with mashed potatoes too. I tried some of his food and I thought it was very good too! I actually liked it more than my dish even though I'm a huge pasta fan and not much of a salmon fan!
author: Elaine N.

description:
This has to be my worst experience ever at a restaurant. Being on vacation we decided to end our last night in the city at this so called restaurant due to the view and outside seating. Worst Mistake Ever..

We came to the host and put our name on the list and were told it was going to be a 50 minute wait, which it was. We understood because it's Saturday night and many people like the view as well. We waited right around 50 minutes and got to our seat. We never got introduced by our waitress and ordered drinks that took roughly 15 minutes to arrive. We also didn't get bread for about 15 minutes and when we did, we never got butter.. I then ordered a Rib eye "MEDIUM RARE" with Mac & Cheese & Green Beans and my girlfriend ordered Farfalle Pasta. Come to find out they were out of that so she ordered the Shrimp Angel Hair. We waited 1 hour for our food and the Manager did come out and apologize due to the wait time. Which we were semi ok with due to the scenery. We then recieved our meals 3-4 minutes after the manager had talked to us. My steak was WELL DONE, and I never recieved the MAC n Cheese which they later brought out after my meal was done. My green beans were cold as if they were in the fridge and thrown on a plate. Her Pasta was bland but was edible. As we got our check they couldn't even have some type of sincerity to give us the free mac and cheese that came out after my plate was gone. Why would I want to just eat Mac N Cheese?

I'm truly just disappointed on waiting so long for our food and it to turn out so bad. I didn't even eat my meal due to it being so so awful. The service was just terrible and truly disappointing. I know we will never come here and ever step foot into another CheeseCake Factory.
author: Alex L.

description:
One of the things I like about The Cheesecake Factory is that it's consistent from city to city, I always know what to expect! A friend of mine came into the Union Square location for a late Friday afternoon lunch. We ended up snagging seats in the bar area and ordering drinks and appetizers. We had the burger sliders, add cheese and bacon, and HOLY COW...THE BEST SLIDERS I'VE EVER HAD!! Our waiter was awesome, my water glass was never empty (which is a common occurrence for me!), he gave food recommendations after listening to what we were in the mood for, and was even nice enough to give us recommendations of bars and lounges to visit the rest of the weekend!

The only reason that they got minus one star is the drink prices. They seem a little high for what they are...and because it's a corporate chain, I feel like they have their standard drink mixes that aren't strong at all, so not sure that it's anything against the bartender.
author: Shelby H.

description:
Came hear for lunch time considering it wasn't that busy . However the place itself is really nice but a bit noisy. They offer out door seating which has great views of downtown. On the other hand their hostess is need training on how to sit people because their wait time went from 15 minutes turned into 1hr and all three of the hostess said the same thing five minutes I was ready to walk out at this point until the manager came and asked told me five more minutes I'm like that's what they have been saying for the last hr? Initially it was 15 min now we're at 1 hr and everyone that is coming in is getting seated so I was bothered already! So a customer overheard the manager and he said theirs no excuse we just got hear and we got a table right away ! So things are not looking good already so with that being said we finally got a table. 

Food wise - we got fettuccini Alfredo lunch portions are a good size however I wish the chicken was cut in smaller pieces. And the sauce was broken down but the flavor was good. 

Crab Cakes- bite size crab cakes I loved them they were small but full of flavor and packed with crab meat that is a must for sure if you like crab cakes!

Calamari- light and airy fried to perfection it was really delicious and they give you two dipping sauces which is better than just one like most places do!

Kids corn dogs- really good and great portion fries were nice and crisp overall the food was really good which I was surprised considering most reviews are about the food . But I'm glad I had patience to stay and try it because it was worth it great views and food was delicious.!! Would I go their again? Of course I would just be more cautious about the wait time !
author: Mirna P.

description:
Cheesecake Factory is usually one of those consistent restaurants that you can go to anywhere and get the same experience. However, my experiences at this Cheesecake Factory have set the bar way lower. The problem is that this place is too busy, which albeit is more the fault of the city of San Francisco for being so restaurant chain-averse: Cheesecake Factory is one of the only well-known restaurants near Union Square. The wait here is often 1+ hours long, and service is mediocre because the restaurant knows people will still come. 

I've ate here a few times before I more or less gave up on the restaurant's service and wait times, and I started ordering take-out from here more often because the food is still usually good *if you get the right meal,* but I've still had a lot of problems with this:

1) I've ordered take-out and they say that it will be ready at x time, and it actually isn't ready until 40 minutes after x time.
2) Last week I got take out Parmesan Crusted Chicken Breast, which I've gotten many times. I took a bite out of it and it something hard. I spat it back out and dug through it and found a nice ~1 in long bone in there. 
3) I ordered take out, walked all the way there, walked all the way home to find out they gave me the wrong meal. I called them because I wanted the right meal and was put on hold for a few minutes and started walking back to the restaurant. 45 minutes later when I got back to the restaurant, I was still on hold. They took another ~20 minutes preparing the right meal and didn't even refund me. 

I've lost my patience with this restaurant and don't plan on going back anytime soon.
author: Kristin A.

description:
The Cheesecake Factory probably has three things going for it. The outdoor seating overlooking Union Square, perhaps the widest menu in town, and ummm... cheesecake. 

It's touristy but that also makes it perfect for out-of-the-country visitors for some "American" food - portion size and all. Something for everyone because EVERYTHING is on the menu. And then you top it off with cheesecake. But with so many items, it's quantity over quality. 

Pro tip: The line is notoriously long with typically over an hour waits. If you don't need the view, there's a separate line for the bar which includes a couple of small tables. You'll be seated way faster and the servers are just as friendly.
author: Jon L.

description:
Wow, they really need to do something about the line/hoard of people during dinner rush. Theres got to be a better system. Arrived at 5:30pm for Saturday dinner, was seated by 6pm on the patio, score! Pretty fast service for how packed it was. 
Loved the patio but not worth the wait for standard CF cuisine.
author: Khol M.

description:
If you are looking for the All-American-Multiserving-Sized Entrees, look no further​ because this place has just that. I honestly have not been to a Cheesecake Factory in a while, and I do not remember the portions being huge! It's enough to adequately feed 3 people!

My family and I came here after going to the Museum of Ice Cream, which I might add; seems to be the place to go to judging by the plastic sprinkles on the women's restroom floor. This is usually our go-to place to eat when we are around Union Square, though.

We were seated right away for a party of 6. We decided to dine inside. Our server's name was Julius (I know this because my mom asked him, like, 3 times or so). He was a nice dude and spaced our meals out well. He never let anyone's drink go past half-full.

I ordered the Skinnylicious Grilled Salmon, and that​ too was enough to feed at least 2 people. It was also a low calorie​ meal. Everything seemed to be 1000+ calories because the serving sizes are huge! Everyone was happy with what they got, and we ended up having to take it all home for lunch the next day.
author: Nikki P.

description: I've been to Cheesecake Factory on a few occasions across US.  The kids never heard of it (obviously, they don't watch "The Big Bang Theory").  They were surprised that this place served did other than desserts.  And they do it well!  My son had his favorite pasta, carbonara.  It did not disappoint!  I had a great beet, goat cheese, and green salad.  It was very good.  And of course, we had cheese cake for dessert.  Very, very good!  The menu is way tooooo big, with tonnes of choices.  That usually means that the food is not great.  But our choices turned out great.  Coming back again, just for dessert.
author: Kevin B.

description:
My friend weirdly loves this place and said we HAD to go since it had been 15-ish years since I'd last gone...

Yeah, there's a reason I don't go here. It ain't worth it. 

Crazy lines, food is bland, overcooked, generic, and expensive, yes you get a nice view BUT no heat lamps by us so we're freezing...

Only good thing was the actual cheesecake and the server was very friendly... But that's not enough to get me to go back. 

SF is known for their food. Go elsewhere and I will too.
author: Mandi W.

description: Insanely slow service! We were told it would be a 50 minute wait which was fine as Macy's is below so we did some shopping. There is no room to wait around the restaurant. Once we sat down, it took asking multiple waiters to get the bread. The food took a good 20-30 minutes to come out as well. Food is standard Cheesecake Factory food that comes in good-sized portions. I really like the mashed potatoes. Prices are decent as well. The only reason people come here is because of the nice location.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Shoutout to the host Gabby for going above and beyond. She does her job very well and is very professional in handling guest. Thanks for giving the best service ever in helping me and my party seat in an area that I wanted. You the real MVP!

Also thanks for the awesome attentive service Angel! You rocked it out in my party of 3 experience at the Cheesecake Factory. Thanks fro getting the heater to turn on as well since the server before you switched didn't seem to check in well.

Sad that the restaurant discontinued Eggplant Parmagiana since that was my go to. The Miso Salmon was delicious but pretty sweet. Brown bread with oats delicious!!!! And I feel like one of the female food runners was not having a good day. Seemed like she hated what she was doing. But, she probably was having a bad day.

But definitely, thanks Gabby and Angel for the Awesome Experience and the amazing view outside where I sat was breathtaking.
author: Jray M.

description:
Went to Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday at 11:30a. Wasn't that crowded. But, when it came to noon, that was a different story. The crowds started coming in. It was packed. If you want to eat here, eat early. 

Great place to meet friends to chit-chat. Food wise, I was not too pleased with my grilled fish tacos. My friend enjoyed her salad though. Service was good. 

One thing I wish Cheesecake Factory had is reservations!
author: C W.

description:
F/ING DESPICABLE.

I put in an order for a 6 inch cheesecake and was ready to wait and pick up in 10-15 minutes, given that it's around 6 pm and busy. I was patient. I waited in a 15 person line and paid for the total at the cashier. 

No, instead I wait 50 minutes (AND STILL WAITING) for a cheesecake that I PRE-ORDERED. I ask the cashier for an update on my cake and she says there's an assembly line they go through. And she gives ME attitude saying yeayeayea when I tell her 5 groups behind me have already gotten their order. 

It's literally a 6 inch cheesecake. Just put it in a freaking box and that's it. 

I'm still waiting at this restaurant, watching the clock tick down because I'm unable to leave without this item I paid for. 

Literally the shittiest pick up experience.  Will not be coming back here. Waste of my time.
author: Emily F.

description:
***ONLY RATED ON DESSERTS

Dessert: 4/5
Service: 3.5/5
Ambiance: 3.5/5
Overall: If you want a sweet treat then definitely a place to come.  But I'd only suggest taking it to go!

The extended review...

Food:

Linda's Fudge Cake - If you want a moist and rich cake...this is your best bet.  It's super decadent.  Probably can't finish the whole thing at once though.

Service:  Staff can be hit or miss but the most part friendly though.

Ambiance:  Of all the times I've come here, I have to say that it's ALWAYS packed.  My guess is that most of the clientele are tourists since it's in Union Square.  The wait to dine in...though I haven't attempted this in quite a while...is super long.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
1/5 for the lacklustre greeting 
2/5 for the Cobb Salad (they took it off our bill) 
4/5 for the other meals 
5/5 for the specialty coffee 
5//5 for our Server 
5/5 for the ambiance on the outdoor terrace (although it was a tad cold)
author: Anthony W.

description: Waiting there for like 25-30 minutes for a cheese cake slice nobody even bothers to check. I asked to cashier about my order but all he said his mistake and never even cared to rectify his mistake. I had really good experience at other cheesecake factories but this one really lack customer service.
author: LLeo W.

description:
Food taste good but there's honestly better places to for a date or other fancy occasions.   

Yes the views of Union Square are pretty cool but I personally don't think it's worth the ~30 minute wait to be seated and ~20 minutes to get your food. Plus, most places are way to over priced and the staff's attention to detail doesn't fit the price your paying for service.  (I'm not trying to talk i'll of the staff, they're nice people genuinely trying to do their best...) however, their level of service just isn't on par with the type do service you'd revive at other restaurant where you pay this much per plate.  (If you get what I'm trying to say?) 

(If you're looking for a good date spot, don't be basic, take them to a steak house!)
author: David I.

description:
I really want to give this sh*t hole zero stars, so thank yelp that I'm not able to! 

We ( a party of 14) with 6 kids came here in hopes of enjoying a nice meal after the candytopia and boy was we wrong!

The manager JOHN is a worthless individual, told us it will be a 30 minute wait for two tables so we would be next to each other but just 7 at one table and 7 at the other, a hour later we questioned him about our table, he then gave us the run around that they are getting it ready now. 5 people from our party left because the wait was ridiculous, we informed John assuming that this would lessen our wait time, he told us that's better now we can sit at one table, great! 

So we wait ... another 30 minutes pass and we are like John we have hungry kids here, and you are the nearest place open why have we been here over an hour and a half when you first said 30, we were more then patient with him! Very rude and nonchalantly he said our table is ready. When we start walking to the area he shows us 4 different tables that are not near each other and say that's where we're sitting ! We waited over an hour and Half for you to mess up our table situation ??? Who in there right mind would come with 14 people get told our table would be ready in 30 for us all to wait over an hour and a half to sit at different tables ??? We are all, tired and livid with hungry babies! So of course we let him know how unprofessional and how much of an inconvenience this was and he did nothing to accommodate us! No, sorry, no nothing! Made it seem like it was our problem For coming with so many people! and it is 9 O clock at night. We left, I did not want to spend my money at a place like this! John you need to have a one on one coaching on customer service and learn not to mislead your customers!!! I will never come back here and I will never recommend this sad excuse of a restaurant!
author: Taniesha L.

description: Did not have a great experience at all. The wait for my group was an hour and a half, which was reasonable for a Friday night, however, the server we had gave a rude attitude and was pretty sassy when serving us. The food came out cold. Luke warm at the most. And the food took a very long time to come out. The only great thing about this place is the bread, and the view outside. I was very disappointed in the quality of food, and the service overall. Won't be coming back here. I would only suggest coming here if you would like a nice view, but the wait and the service here isn't worth it. A busy restaurant does not justify for rude and disrespectful behavior. Never coming back again.
author: Dennis M.

description:
I came to this particular Cheesecake Factory with my teammates on our day off. The service from the entrance to our table was rude and very nonchalant. We received dirty silverware , poor service , and slow responses during our experience. We are new to this city and felt very disrespected a manager is and will be spoken too. 
I don't recommend this location.. I've never had such service :(  

Very pretty view / be cautious of birds
author: Jada J.

description:
They always have a long wait here, but the food is worth it. Their Alfredo pasta is delicious with huge quantity. The unique cheese cake flavors is also delicious but pricey. 

Perks:
shop while waiting for a table
author: Linsey F.

description:
I usually like going to Cheesecake Factory but this has got to be absolutely one of the grossest restaurant visits I've ever had in history. My son LOVES burgers and ordered the cheese stuffed burger. 

After eating about 3/4 of his burger he decided to pull the bread off. The restaurant was very dimly lit but he felt the burger didn't look right. I turned the light on my phone to get a better look and his patty was squishy and just about RAW. I'm not talking pink in the inside, I'm talking outside of the patty was not cooked and looked like the just threw the bread on a raw patty. 

The server (who was very nice) looked embarrassed and admitted the grill guy didn't cook it correctly and I was closer to "rare" side (uh, yeah I'd say so). It was comped. Glad they did that but I was scared my son would end up sick from eating a raw burger!

Don't go here. I think they're too busy to offer any quality and safe food handling!  GROSS!
author: Cherilyn P.

description:
We came here for dinner since we had a gift card. We waited about 30-40 minutes on a Saturday night around 6pm. We expected it much longer since there was so many people waiting. We ordered the avocado egg roll, ribeye and steak diane/herb crusted salmon. I really like the avocado egg roll. The other dishes were decent but nothing amazing. The service was a bit slower than I was used to but I guess it was pretty busy. Honestly, I wouldn't have thought to come here to eat if it wasn't for the gift card. However, the cheesecakes here are really good!

I would probably return for the happy hour or when I'm craving some cheesecake.
author: Kim N.

description:
I never thought I'd give a 4 stars to Cheesecake Factory, but I guess I just did.

Most likely because of their skinnilicious menu, I think! And their complimentary bread and butter. Oh wait, and their service!

I was surprised that on a busy Saturday afternoon, there was only 10-15 minutes wait to get seated. The pager actually buzzed sooner and my friend and I for seated immediately.

Though the restaurant was jam packed, the waitress did a fairly good job take our orders soon. My grip though was the complimentary bread and butter being served very late - after our drinks and a few minutes before the meal was going to be served.

I had ordered a Mojito and Grilled Salmon from their skinnilicious menu. Loved the Mojito - especially the muddled mint offering a refreshing flavor in the heat.

The grilled salmon also comes with veggies, such as asparagus, carrots, beans. Both the veggies and the salmon were very good.

I couldn't complain much about this place. I wouldn't hesitate coming to Cheesecake Factory again. I may not try other dishes, but would love to stick with their Mojito and Salmon!
author: Anu M.

description: This is by far my favorite Cheesecake Factory location, especially after a long day of shopping Downtown. We came on a Wednesday night, it was busy as usual but we were able to snag a seat after a 30 minute wait. We had Derek as our server and he was excellent, very attentive and had great recommendations. We got the Avocado Rolls to start and those were DELICIOUS. I got the Steak Diane for my entree and the pumpkin cheesecake (recommended by Derek) and both were great, although the original strawberry is still my favorite. Overall we had great experience, as expected whenever we go to a Cheesecake Factory. I definitely will be back when I need to get some Christmas shopping done.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
Absolutely love this location out of all the others in the Bay Area. Top floor of the Macy's building.

On a nice sunny day the outside area is the best place minus the pigeons. If you can get past that part you'll enjoy it as much as I do. 

Depending on what time you come there may be a wait but if you come after rush times, you'll be seated in no time. 

I have go-to dishes for this establishment. Stuffed mushrooms, chicken pot stickers (the sauce is amazing), chicken maderia is my all time fav, and I like the strawberry shortcake for dessert. 

I'm not a cheesecake person but do enjoy looking at the variety of selects ppl can get. My mom tries a new slice of cheescake every time we come. 

Breakfast is even cool, I've come here before with my laptop to do some work while eating and drinking the peach Bellini's (a must have with breakfast).
author: Kyshia M.

description:
All i got to say is they forgot we were their an they gave our table to someone else and didn't get our drinks till 20 min later, if I could give zero stars I would.Im sure to say im never going their again.
We were told 30min wait but it took them 2 hr to give us our table an two soft drinks.
author: Alvaro F.

description: Food was good. While waiting a long time to get in you get to stare at the available cheesecakes. I had the salmon kale salad...a but overwhelmed with the kale could not taste anything else. The key lime cheesecake seemed watery.  The service was slow slow slow.  We were unhappy with the service. Sunday evening packed with people.
author: Terry O.

description:
So did the price just surge or did I not notice.
The guality is about the same and the views are nice if you plan it out right you can squeeze in some shopping.
author: nancy w.

description:
This is one busy place!  It took an hour or more from signing in to getting seated!  Our group had to kill time by going around Macy's...or the huge crowd and the thinning air would have driven us mad!  And we were told that being seated in an hour is actually fast and lucky!

The serving staff are quite attentive.  And friendly.  They took the usual drink and appetizer orders first.  And after a few more minutes from the delivery of our drinks, our orders were taken.  We were a party of 6, and our orders came in quite promptly.  Our server was still attentive and looking after us...until we started worrying about where the 6th order was.  After 15 minutes, a sheepish staff member (probably a super) informed us that our 6th order was taken to another table by mistake and that it will take them 15 minutes to replace it.  For the time being, would you like some chips?  Anything?  Well, how about not charging us for the 6th due to the delay?  No luck.  And they actually exceeded the 15 minute mark as well!  We were told they were quite busy... excuses... excuses... excuses...

The food was not all that great.  This location, compared to other Cheesecake locations, is suffering.  It's very popular because of its location to Union Square...but that may also be its curse...
author: Arnel S.

description: Like other Cheesecakes the menu is full of options with practically anything you can imagine. On Saturday and Sunday there's a separate brunch menu with special items. Pictured is the eggs benedict. What makes this location unique is the rooftop dining terrace with a view of Union Square, but come early or make a reservation as it fills up quickly.
author: Rad A.

description:
Awwww this Cheesecake Factory is super special to me!

It was the very first Cheesecake Factory I ever went to! I remember spending the day with my uncle and sister in SF when we were kids and my uncle took us here for lunch. When we were younger my sister and I would always order something from the kids menu like chicken tenders or something cheap but we always got to feast when we were with our uncle since he didn't have any kids himself.

I remember my uncle ordered the crab cake burger (not sure if it's still on the menu) and he let me order it too! I felt like a million bucks! It was so delicious and I fell in love with Cheesecake Factory ever since. Throughout high school I would always go to this location with my friends. It has the best view of Union Square, especially during Christmas time with they have the tree up and the ice skating rink.

I recently came back here with my mom on Friday for some mother-daughter bonding lunch while we were in the city shopping for Xmas. I really think Cheesecake Factory should rent out the floor below them of Macy's, it's not like people really shop department stores anymore anyway. It's always a super duper long line here because of the view. The wait was 45 minutes this time. The whole front desk area was crammed with people waiting for a table. I had time to go down a few levels and grab a white elephant gift. 

Our server was nice as always whenever you go to any CF. I ordered the Thai Coconut Lime Chicken and my mom got the Crispy Pineapple Chicken and Shrimp. Both were very good. 

Great Cheesecake Factory location, just make sure you put your name down first before going shopping so that you can minimize your wait time.
author: Ramona G.

description:
Hello my friends, 
Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places for desserts. I have been here several times with my friend and I really like it. We ordered cappuccinos and two cheesecakes. Mine was White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Cheesecake. It was amazing! Tasty, delicious, creamy! I want to come back again! The service was good, not the best in the world but it is OK.
author: Elena L.

description:
I normally don't do this. 

I almost never ask to speak to a manager but after tonight's shenanigans in being seated, yeah, it was necessary.

The Cheesecake Factory is deservedly busy, especially at this location on the top floor of Macy's Union Square, especially five days before Christmas.

We only waited 40 minutes for a table, an estimate they accurately predicted.

But as my little boy and I were led to the outdoor patio with beautiful holiday views of the Macy's Christmas tree, the skating rink and holiday lights in all the top drawer retailers' windows, the hostess led us to a table away from that view while 4-5 other tables were empty and service-ready. 

I asked to be seated closer to the Union Square view.

Hostess:
"Oh, those are reserved."

Me:
"Huh. They are? There's no designation."

Hostess:
"Well, they are. These two are reserved."

[Now highly suspicious and wondering why we were in this table push/pull]

Me: 
"Well [pointing], how about this one?"

Hostess:
"That's reserved too, there's only this table."

Me:
"Well, what's the difference between THIS 4-top (hey, I waitressed my way through college, I got the lingo) and THIS one?"

Hostess:
"It's reserved."

Me:
(Amused) "No it's not."

Hostess:
"That's all we have, unless you want to wait another 30 minutes."

(Ok, now she threw down the gauntlet)

Most people- especially hungry people avec child- would hear "30 more minutes" and fold at this point but not me.

Me:
"Well...no one asked me if I wanted a *view* table, that if I did that it'd be a longer wait. Couldn't we just have *this table?"

Exasperated, she told us "THAT'S what [she] was assigned" (temper flaring) and asked us to follow her like naughty children being led to the principal's office.

I looked at my child, he gave me a giggle, and we followed her...

(Secret meeting at the reservation desk I wasn't privy to)

A few moments later, she told us to follow her and  we were led back onto the patio and wordlessly given the table that'd been open to begin with.

So I sat there with my son talking about his day and admiring the view. But after a few minutes, I realized my irritation wouldn't dissipate.

So I asked the server for the manager, reassuring it wasn't her, she was lovely.

Waiting, I pulled up my LinkedIn message page and when the manager came by, I explained what happened and how much I admired The Cheesecake Factory who was for a long time my client, the #2 guy who'd helped build the restaurant group having left the company but I was still friendly with.

"And oh here, look: My LinkedIn page- here he is, X sent me a note he was in Dubai last month."

I told the manager about the fable of the "reserved" tables and advised him not to lie to guests. He looked down, a little ashamed. 

I lightly scolded "Guests always find out and feel bad about it."

Seriously, The Cheesecake Factory, you're better than this and quality and consistency are your hallmarks.

Of course the food was good, The Cheesecake Factory does everything well, but service in aggregate, rounded up to a sad C.

Please let this have been a one day holiday crush/glitch but if not, fix.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
The cheesecake Factory used to be my favorite place.Today I came around 3:00 PM and there are not busy. We get table very fast but service was slow.The food that we ordered take too long. We ordered Pork chop and Pasta Carbonara.I think Pork chop is a little bit dry and I feel like the pasta is half-cooked.The server never check back and ask how was everything.

Very disappointed :(
author: Panpaporn K.

description: This was the first Cheesecake Factory I ever went to. I had no idea what to expect, as I went to Macy's to see what they had. The person at the top was so friendly that I decided to try it. I was seated alone on the balcony and spent 30 minutes looking through all the food they had. I finally asked my waitress what she would recommend and she said her favorite was the Chicken Madeira, though with the yellow and gold linguine and not the potatoes as it comes with. I asked for that and a salad as a started not at all expecting the mass of food I got. I was full after the salad but tried the Madeira and loved it. I also got the Carrot Cake Cheesecake to try and it was delicious too. Needless to say I had leftovers for days and was fine with that. Pricey, but delicious.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
My fav place in sfo !
But always busy, please make reservations and be ready for 45 min wait time on weekends. Drinks are expensive but vegetarian options are great ! Definitely try the avocado toast and vegetarian burger 

I didn't like the tiramisu cheesecake but the mango one is good
author: Anamika A.

description:
So this past Sunday, we went to The Cheesecake Factory in Union Square for dinner to celebrate my cousin's birthday. The wait was about 40 minutes so they gave us a buzzer to let us know when it was our turn. Our turn came and we got seated. About 10 minutes later, our server came by and asked us what we would like to drink. We ordered waters all around and some lemonades. We got our drinks 10 minutes later and the server left without saying a word. We're sipping our drinks and looking at the menu deciding what we want to order when we realize that they haven't given us any bread and butter yet. The server comes back 15 minutes later to take our orders and after he finishes going around the table, we asked if we can get some bread as well as some drink refills since we had pretty much finished them while we were waiting for him to come back. He comes back, you guessed it, another 10 minutes later with a single basket of bread for our party of 6 guys. That's not even the worst part: The brown rye bread was fuckin BURNT black and hard as a rock. If you're gonna burn the bread, at least burn the white bread that no one wants but you give us anyway. At that point, we were hella hungry from waiting so long so we just ate the white bread, you know, the one that Cheesecake Factory isn't famous for that didn't get burnt. Anyways, so we eventually got our real food and while the server was delivering everyone's plate, we asked for refills of our drinks so we wouldn't die of dehydration as well as another basket of rocks, I mean bread, preferably not burnt this time. Safe to say, we never got the bread and our drink refills came when we were almost done with our food. Keyword: almost. I ordered the Bistro Shrimp Pasta and I never got to finish it because my friend finished his plate so the server took his plate away then assumed I was done too and took mine away without even asking if I was done. I still had like 3 whole shrimps and about 2 good forkfuls (is that a word?) of pasta left when it was taken away from me and I still think about it every night before I go to sleep. I always wonder how different my life would be if I was able to enjoy those last couple bites but it's ok because life goes on. Alright so back to the review. As I mentioned in the beginning of the review, it was my cousin's birthday so one of our friends snuck off to tell the waiter so the employees can ambush us later and sing the happy birthday song to my cousin while he sits there awkwardly not knowing what to do with a dumbass look on his face. As you may or may not know, it's usually tradition for the person celebrating their birthday to be given a free slice of cheesecake during their visit. The waiter comes back 5 days later holding the World's Smallest Plate with the tiniest scoop of vanilla ice cream I've ever seen in my life. My bad, last time I checked I thought this was The Cheesecake Factory, not Baskin Robbins. We thought it was some kind of sick joke and Ashton Kutcher was gonna pop out telling us we got Punk'D...it wasn't a joke. This was real. They had the audacity to tell us they ran out of cheesecake talking about some "This is all we had". Overall, the food was good but the service was atrocious. Better off driving down to Hillsdale but I mean hey if you're feeling kinky and in the mood to get choked during your meal from their famous rock bread, no water, and a side of disappointment, hit up Cheesecake Factory in Union Square.

Fun Fact: I typed this entire review using my two middle fingers
author: Ali O.

description:
I recommend going for the weekend brunch. The staff aren't very attentive. But they will bring another basket of bread.

If you go for Saturday and/or Sunday brunch, you most definitely should try the creme brûlée French toast! They claim to be the best and live up to its name!

We also ordered the Cajun jambalaya, s'mores and white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. The Cajun jambalaya is a classic choice for us. Sometimes the chicken can seem undercooked, just beware so you don't experience salmonella.

The cheesecake options are wide and ginormous! Highly recommend sharing! The s'mores cheesecake is heavy tasting, regarding the chocolate but delicious. The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake is a lighter choice if you're stuffed from the appetizer and entrees.
author: Jenny C.

description:
My first time here and to be fair it was a Friday night but I ordered a well done mushroom burger without mayonnaise and received something more like medium well instead.

Upon receiving the well done burger, the cook had put the mayonnaise on the second burger.

They removed the well done mayonnaise burger only to wipe off the mayo from the bread and bring back the same well done patty with a little mayonnaise still on the underside of the patty.

I rarely send anything back and haven't ever sent something back twice.  I was impressed by the decor and upscale feel to this Cheesecake Factory location but would not recommend this for its service.  3rd time probably isn't a charm with the orders here.

They offered more food by at that point I'd given up. The manager was kind and removed the burger from the bill, kept the lemonade on the bill and gave free cheesecake even though I said I didn't eat cheesecake.  Guess the waiter didn't think to offer an alternative to cheesecake.
author: Roxy M.

description:
We love this place . Be prepared to wait to be seated at least 45 mins. There is a parking garage across the street which is cheap as compared to other parking lot around. 
Food is very good . Don't forget to ask for bread while u wait for for your food. :)
author: Bandana R.

description:
Possibly the WORST Cheesecake Factory I've been too. 

I WILL NEVER RETURN

Our initial wait time was 40 mins and ran about closer to an hour, we weren't mad because we understand how busy it can be. But after being seated we had to wait 15 minutes for waters AND THEN we were told they ran out of bread for the rest of the night!! 
How is that possible! We were very hungry and the least they could of done was give us a discount on fries so we wouldn't have to wait with empty stomachs! 
We ordered our food and the waiter came back 5 minutes later to tell us they also ran out of filet mignon :( Ugghh

The food took 35+ minutes to arrive. I ordered the pasta and it was quite delicious. My girlfriend ordered the Evelyn pasta and it was dry and bland !


The waiter came very few times to our table and took him a while to bring us the check. 
BUT WAIT HERES THE BEST PART...!!!
He came back 10 minutes after I gave him the check and had the audacity to ask if I wanted my change back.. when I told home "yes" he said "okay" and didn't show up for over 15 minutes. THAT IS RIDICULOUS!!! After 15 minutes I decided the change wasn't worth my time it was well past 10:30 and We just wanted to go home. So I decided to leave the change with him and leave. 

When we began to walk out my girlfriend and sister needed to use the restroom. They walked in to the ladies room and ALMOST IMMEDIATELY RAN OUT!!!

THERE WAS BLOOD ALL OVER THE WALLS IN THE STALL!! We notified a couple of employees and they went to go check it out and they were also disgusted!!


In total we were there at least 3 hours. 
I think my money and time would of been spent better at bubba gumps. At least there wouldn't be what appeared to be blood on the walls.
author: Gustavo P.

description:
I had a very nice time here last night 
Brought my sister and her friends here.
They were visiting from Ireland ..kinda busy place didn't take long before we had a seat

And a very nice waitress called Leo she gets 5 stars for being on point and super nice
author: Joseph B.

description: I'm changing my review to five stars based on customer service. Cheesecake Factory reaches out to me after my review to follow up on my experience. I always am impressed by businesses that make sure their image is good on yelp.
author: Marcus K.

description:
This restaurant's staff exhibits grace under pressure - from the hosts, to the servers, to the bartenders and the bussers.

On a busy weekday evening, I learned the wait would be about an hour, but if I sat at the bar, I could be seated when there was an empty chair. This quickly occurred.

I noticed that portions were very generous, so didn't order an appetizer or salad. The menu is huge, like the restaurant, which seats about 300. The friendly bartender took my order of Evelyn's Pasta (a friend's recommendation), and the food arrived quickly after I was served nicely warmed bread. The pasta had a good variety of vegetables and was cooked al dente. I ordered the lemon meringue cheesecake for dessert, which is delicious. 

I'll return to try other items, especially the desserts. I recommend you visit when in the area, and sit at the bar to avoid the wait.
author: Carol W.

description:
Can't go wrong with this place especially during Christmas time! It is a little bit of a wait however we were blessed to only wait 5 minutes on a Wednesday @ 4:30 awesomeness!! I love their charbroiled hamburgers so juicy!! Mmmm Love this restaurant. This is a must see when 
in San Francisco area.
author: Roxy L.

description:
Let me preface this by saying: It's a commercial chain, in a heavy traffic area in a city that happens to be a global tourist attraction. It all depends on the time of day and what day you go - that will directly impact your experience. I am a more laid back, avoid the hustle and bustle so i start early. Brunch time.

Parking is Ample across the street in parking garage. Its not free. And they DO NOT Validate. About 8Bucks. After taking the SINGLE elevator up to the CF, you walk out into a dimly lit area that is sorta confusing at first. Once you locate the host counter you're good. I've come in before and been seated right away if you arrive early enough. Let me babble off a few likes I have for this place...

The staff is attentive.
The restrooms are clean.
The wait is inevitable.
The drinks are Marginally Standard in price and potency, but Delicious.
The Seating options are vast and varied (outdoors, bar, table, booth...).
The portions are INCREDIBLY generous and the flavors are as Variable as their variety of cheesecakes (there is an endless list).

The only downside is the crowds. The wait. Their menu is extensive enough to suit even the most demanding of diners.
author: P. A.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and left with a SUPER filled belly. I highly recommend sharing your meal with your friends, unless you're already planning on taking home leftovers.

This Cheesecake Factory is located next to Union Square, and if you choose to dine outdoors, then you get a nice view that overlooks SF's most popular tourist attraction. We came here in early November, so the big tree and the ice rink was already set-up! The only major con about eating outdoors are all the pigeons, so if you're not a fan, then make sure you specify that you want indoor seating only. Since we came here on a Saturday afternoon, it was a standard 30-minute to 1-hour wait.

When we were finally seated, we had an awesome waitress who had lots of energy and also gave us amazing service. For food, we started with the Factory Nachos, which was a huge nacho dish complete with guac, salsa, spicy chicken, jalapeños, and sour cream. We shared this amongst 4 people, and it was so good that it went away in less than 10 minutes. After our appetizer, my friend and I split the Factory Burger. It was super moist and packed with flavor, and describing it is making my taste buds water because it was so succulent!  Of course, we had to order a cheesecake to finish off our meal. We got the specialty birthday cake cheesecake, which tasted like a funfetti ice cream cake! ALSO, the complimentary bread that they serve always wins me over, especially the whole wheat.

Overall, we had a great lunch at The Cheesecake Factory. If I come here next time, then I hope to get the same waitress (I actually forgot her name, but she had this unicorn pin!) because she was a real MVP!
author: Randall O.

description: I only come to the Cheesecake Factory  just to enjoy these two! Downtown sf always has a wait. But it's worth it. Ask to sit outside to enjoy the view from the balcony! Food and service is always great! Can't go wrong with my salmon and peach drannnnkkkk!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I'm from Washington, and have been to the Bellevue Cheesecake Factory several times. All 5 stars experiences, so when visiting in September it was recommended we go to this Union Square, CF location for lunch, I was happy to!
My sisters and I ordered salads. I choose the cobb salad. 
Never have I had such an awful looking salad placed in front of me...and this was after about 45 minutes of waiting for our orders. 
What I received was a plate full of lettuce that was pale and old looking. There were about 4 bite sized pieces of chicken, a tablespoon or so of diced crumbled egg, 3 or 4 small bite size cubes of avocado, about 2 tablespoons of diced tomato, and a couple tablespoons of bacon...maybe.  
Any other time at any restaurant you usually receive at least a half breast of sliced chicken, near a whole sliced boiled egg, plenty of tomato's, bacon, and cheese. The cobb salad is normally a meal. 
The salads in front of my sisters were no better looking. It was insulting.
I know it was not the servers fault, but I gently inquired as to why the salads were like this...she said they were all proportioned out. ????
What does that mean? Proportioned for a toddler? I let her know that for the price of the salad, 4 bites of chicken just seemed really odd. She talked to her manager and then brought us back a small bowl of chicken pieces to share...and there would be "no additional charge". 
Overall, this experience was awful and disappointing. Oh, and my niece did not order a salad, her lunch was okay, except after she ate she got very sick...and spent some time in the restroom.
author: Tessa S.

description:
So today for my birthday I wanted to get a cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory as a first time experience. Everything went well with the transaction as well as a nice receptionist until we thought we could dine at the restaurant itself. When I meant "we", I was referring to my mother who accompanied me. Back to the story at hand, my mother thought that we could sit at one of the tables since we purchased a slice of cake. When we were close to the table, we were given a stern look by a waitress with a passive aggressive attitude telling us that we were not allowed to sit at the table for buying a slice without making a reservation. We were shocked and surprised by her attitude as it read that she wanted us to leave immediately. It nearly ruined my birthday, at least the cake was good. 

I was not able to see their name tag, but I remember the waitress being an African American woman with braided hair that was dyed magenta or red purple. She also stood around 6 feet or more. I hope this message gets sent to the manager.
author: Leo C.

description:
Was on a family outing to San Francisco to see the Christmas lights. We decided what better place than the Cheesecake Factory for some lunch. I've been told the view is great at the top of Macy's, and sure enough it was great! 
After the initial 1hr or so wait for a table. We were seated and greeted by Oscar. He was fantastic and really made our experience even better! We ordered our dishes and enjoyed our experience. I had the Turkey Burger with sweet potato fries which was delicious, and topped it off with a cucumber lemonade and a beautiful salted caramel cheesecake. 
Will definitely be coming here again when in the city.
author: Eamon S.

description: Service sucks, hostess whispers so you can't hear how long the wait will be. So then you ask again and she says 15 minutes, but don't be fooled. And don't annoy her by asking about your table 30 minutes later or all of a sudden 15 turns into 45. Then you leave because you only had 2 hours on the meter. Thanks for nothing.
author: T J.

description:
Maybe it's been that long since I've been to a Cheesecake Factory that I forgot what it was all about. Or maybe I outgrew the spark I had in going there. From my good ol' days, The Cheesecake Factory used to be a venue for teen birthdays, and grew into a place for a drink to celebrate a successful shopping trip. 

But this time, all of my memories faded away into real time thoughts of 'Wow Cheesecake is going downhill,' and 'Was Cheesecake always like this, and I never noticed?' I was lost and I didn't like it. 

I went with my go-to, the avocado eggrolls and a slice of cheesecake. I remember coming here and the large portions, so I adjusted accordingly. Thus, Cheesecake became an appetizer and dessert place. The avocado eggrolls came and they looked sad. Small, mis-proportioned, and discoloured, I was not keen to even try to finish them. 

On the lighter side, I chose the Vanilla Bean cheesecake, this was what I remembered. My biggest issue was not the food though, it was the wait time. There was no issue getting an outdoor table for lunch. But the waitress took time bringing water, then the bread. We sat for over half an hour just waiting for our meal. Then getting an order for cheesecake in. Waiting another lengthy time, just for them to bring us a slice of cheesecake. My lunch stretched out to three hours. 

Not only was the wait time like watching grass grow, there was an issue and we were charged another tables bill. It was not the best visit and ate up most of our afternoon. 

The only good thing, was the view. You are up high among the buildings on Union Square. So if you do choose to go here, go for the view and a slice of cheesecake. Surely that can't take forever.
author: Donna D.

description:
For many years now this Cheesecake Factory has been my favorite restaurant because of the great service and amazing food but after today's experience I doubt that I'll ever go back there again.

Utensils at our table were most likely not washed properly as there was all kind of food residue on them. I had to look for our server to get clean set so we can eat,  my biggest complaint is the food. 

I had Bang bang chicken, that usually tastes great, but this dish had so much raw garlic that it was too bitter to eat. Few bites of the food I did have ended up giving me major stomach issues so definitely wouldn't recommend this place
author: Aida R.

description: Tired tourists in search of reliable food, come here.  There are definitely of other, better options, but when you're looking for a place to rest your tired feet and are familiar with their restaurants, come here.  Their cheesecakes are always big winners for everyone especially kids.  They're also trying to offer healthier options - the ahi tuna tartare and seared salmon with kale salads were yummy.  They also provide decent sourdough bread.  Good view of Union Square.  Restaurant is very busy and can be a little dirty.
author: Erika R.

description: Prepare yourself for a diabetic coma. What an array of simply sensational cheesecakes with a cracking view of Union Square. A must for everyone
author: Jim W.

description: It took us about an hour to get a boot here.  The food was decent, but honestly could've been better. We usually go to The Cheesecake Factory in Pleasanton. It seems like they treat us much better there, also the food is much tastier.
author: Royal S.

description: This location is a tourist attraction for the prime location and outdoor seating with the view of Union Square. The service and food options are good. Not really a place for true exquisite cuisine but it's all about the location and cheesecake options.
author: Mary M.

description: It's always a good time at Cheesecake Factory. The bread is crack and probably the best part of Cheesecake Factory. The staff is all so friendly! We had a birthday so that was really fun. The view is really cool too! You can feed the seagulls. My friend fed it a fry and came away uninjured so that's cool. Below is: Cajun Chicken Littles? (I think that's what it's called unless I'm confusing it with KFC), Sheila's Chicken & Avo Salad (also comes in sandwich form), crab bites, Oreo milkshake, Ruben sandwich and Da Vinci Pasta. All tasted great. Too many great memz at Cheesecake Factory!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
I am really super disappointed here. I ordered a white chocolate raspberry cheesecake to be picked up the next day for my sister's birthday. We also took the offer for a piece of chcolate on top with a handwritten message. When I went to pick it up the guy couldn't even find it in his system, I was standing there with my order receipt in my email and they were having a hard time verifying my order. That I paid for already. THEN, they bring us the cake and the custom chocolate piece. The writing looks like a 5 year old wrote it! What's worse?! It said "Happy Birthda".... DID A FIVE YEAR OLD ACTUALLY WRITE IT?! Idk, but when I mentioned it the employees laughed and tethe woman who wrote it. I AM SO GLAD you took my order so seriously, I'm also super glad that I paid $50 for this train wreck. Idk what happened here but you best believe I will never buy from here again. 

UPDATE: shortly after my complaint the company called me and apologized profusely. They sent me a  gift card in the amount of my order. In my opinion, this was an excellent way to handle my less-than-satisfactory experience. Thank you for that.
author: Meg W.

description: Great trendy place for great tasting food.. have been to 6 different locations around the US same plate every location and same great taste
author: Miguel A.

description:
Food: 4/5      Price: 4/5      Service: 1/5      Ambience: 4/5

This Cheesecake Factory is located on the top floor of Macy's next to Union Square. The waiting line is ridiculously long, around 1.5-2 hours if you come at 5pm. Huge place with lots of tables, open kitchen, waiting area, and outdoor patio. The tables are very cramped together, and sidewalks are narrow. Service is extremely slow and inattentive. Takes about 30-40m for your food the arrive after you order.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Like any Cheesecake Factory you can expect the same standard recipes on the menu and great level of service! What sets this location apart from most other locations is the amazing view up above Union Square from the outdoor sitting area! It's great if you can sit outside. Just know this location is flipping amazingly busy so try off eating rush hour times for greater accommodating needs. 

Definitely try this location sometime it's fun!
author: Tiffany M.

description: It's inside Macy's in front of Union Square.  There are all kinds of food on the menu, so it's perfect to go with a big group where everyone wants something different. Also the plates are very big and that justifies the price.  The only problem is that it's crowded and there is a big line during busy hours. Finally, inside, I don't like the decorations, but there is a good view of Union Square.
author: St Giles I.

description:
Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory. You've been to one, I feel you've been to all. 

This particular Cheesecake Factory is very busy and the waits can be quite long, even during the week. And that's obviously because it's in a touristy spot, where many visitors and locals alike go to dine. Now, I've been to this location plenty of times, so I'm not going to knock them on that.

I must say I've had many positive experiences here before, but alas, this review pertains to my most recent visit, wherein I ordered the pepperoni pizza. The pizza came undercooked. The cheese looked like one solid light-yellow mass, instead of golden yellow gooeyness. The crust was not crisp or toasty. It was unbaked softness of thawed out dough. So it was a bummer. Ended up giving it to the homeless gentleman who serves as the unofficial doorman for Macy's and who has amassed quite a collection of donated Cheesecake Factory leftovers.
author: Crissy C.

description: Great service, good food and amazing atmosphere. Try to get outside table for a view
author: Big W.

description: Always a classic. I have been the Cheesecake Factory many times and love the choices on their menu. This location though is so crowded it is so uncomfortable until you are finally seated. However even once you are seated it takes at least 15 minutes for someone to greet you because they are so busy. We ordered off he skinnylicious menu and tried the chicken lettuce wrap tacos which were DELICIOUS! For the main course we had the BBQ Ranch chicken salad - which was pretty bland; and the chicken chipotle pasta which was pretty good!  We finished with the Reeves Pieces cheesecake that was very decadent - so glad we shared it!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: Came here with a party of 10, 4 adults and 6 young children. We waited for an hour. Then they tried to seat us at 4 different tables on opposite sides of restaurant as if it's okay for children to sit alone. When we asked to be seated together the rude manager John told us that this was it and that we could not sit together. Extremely rude and inconsiderate, will be contacting corporate in the morning.
author: K H.

description:
Same as before, I love coming here and I love their food. However, the servers really need to step up. Our waitress was friendly tonight but the rest of the staff felt like they either just don't want to be here or I'm bothering them by asking for a simple napkin. 

I was told the wait for a table inside for 2 on a Tuesday night at 9:00pm was 50 minutes. However, it ended up being only 25 minutes. Also, I appreciate the host for recognizing who were in line vs. who were cutting the line.
author: Alice L.

description:
Very disapointed. 
No taste at all. 
I do not understand why so many people wants to having diner in there.

No good
author: Joon H.

description:
The strawberry margarita was delicious. But the food was totally overpriced for the taste and I regret going. I ordered steak and shrimp scampi with mash potatoes the best thing in the plate was the potatoes. I was not happy with the food 

But for dessert 

cheese cake was bomb.com. So amazing
author: Brianna F.

description:
Located on the 8th floor of Macy's, this place has its own elevator. It was very busy, very crowded, but we didn't have to wait too long.
Service was excellent as always. Food was delicious. Can't wait to go back!
author: Lili L.

description:
Service - 0 Attitude... horrible!!!
Food - 3
Ambience- 4
Price - $$$

Party of 4, 2 meals came out 20 minutes after the first 2 meals. Asked for the manager who came over and said "sorry, we blew it..." then ran away. I had to ask the server for the managers business card. (Michael Kieran) Horrible service, terrible attitudes, apathetic staff. Enough said!
author: John M.

description: 10 years later, I came to Cheesecake Factory. This place was such a disaster, just as I remember it being last. Definitely do not go here if you are hungry and expect to be fed no later than an hour. The night we went, which was a random Saturday, we had to stand in line inside Macy's for a very long time before taking the elevator to the restaurant. Also, the elevator is such a ramshackle that it can only take a handful of people because the weight capacity exceeds after like 6 people step in ( depending on their size ofcourse - could be 3 people ). Anyways, when we finally made it to the restaurant we had to wait some more to get seated. After our buzzer went off, we approached the hostess at the front thinking we were ready to be seated but, nope! We had to wait some more while they called everyone else's names. Finally, after about 2 hours, we get a table outside on the roof. It was night time and a bit chilly, typical SF weather. Our table was right underneath the heater and it kept burning our heads. We requested to switch tables which they accommodated. We ordered avocado egg rolls  for appetizer but were informed the kitchen was all out after waiting for 20 minutes. My friends mom asked for their famous "brown bread" and guess what? They were out! At this point we became a little frustrated with all the waiting and their poor inventory management of ingredients. I randomly ordered chicken samosas instead. There were three tiny triangles that came and were super greasy. Didn't bother with anything else and went straight to ordering main meals. I ordered Tuscan Chicken from their Skinnylicious menu and everyone else on the table just played it safe and ordered salads instead, haha. The only good memory from this experience was the view and bagpipes playing on the street in Union Square. I definitely do not plan to go back here.
author: Natasha S.

description:
I love Cheesecake Factory! But on this visit I have to say I will probably never return. Yes this location always has a wait, it's hit or miss with customer service. I had places an order for the Mac and cheese burger. I waited about 45min and someone other then my waiter brought out my food. I noticed lots of bacon sticking out, so I mention that she must have the wrong table. She then informed me that that's what I ordered! I then told her I have never eaten bacon in my Whole life. She said well that's what you ordered, And walked away. I then asked the next person I saw and asked her for my waiter, and she told me he was on a break. I told her the situation, she left, came back and said he put in a bacon burger. She then left as well. At no time did anybody offer to get me what I wanted.

My server came back and I informed him, her was very sorry for the mistake. At this point I had ate the fries but nothing else. He offered to replace my burger, I told him I couldn't wait any longer for what I had ordered. I brought me the check and offered me some cheesecake. He made it sound like he was going to give it to me for the mistake. I asked for it to go, he then gave me the cheesecake, and my check. I had still been rung up for the burger, I then noticed also the cheesecake. So I paid for a burger I didn't even eat. 

I will never be back!!! 

Came back to visit again, as I told my staff I would take them where ever the would like. I'm going to make this simple, service was horrible no where to be found, other servers said they couldn't help because they weren't our servers, wrong food still delivered again, still charged for it! Then as I went to the bathroom, I come back to the table, my employees were so upset because the server told them how to tip, and made a comment on how teenager don't know how to do it. Mind you these ladies are all servers!  Very rude!! Now they will also never be back!!
author: Cory T.

description:
I know there's that whole stigma going around that millennials don't like chain restaurants, but The Cheesecake Factory was just plain bad.

Sure, the view of Union Square is nice, but it took an hour and a half just to get a table for two on a random Tuesday evening. Once we were seated, service came by intermittently. The jambalaya pasta wasn't great or terrible, but I got a bad case of food poisoning the following day.

If you're in the area, I'd just go to Bartlett Hall or Katana-Ya instead.
author: Casey S.

description:
DO NOT SEAT OUTSIDE!!! GROSS!!!

I can't believe that I had lunch here, especially when I have a pigeon phobia LOL

It was like a..."welcome to the pigeon world! ;D" Haha I'm such a brave girl who went surfing without not knowing how to swim, but when it comes to pigeons....I am the biggest loser ever Lol

Pigeons were everywhere. I know most people are not afraid of them so you probably wouldn't care... but guess what?! I know you all care about sanitation when you come to the restaurant, and let me be honest with you. There is literally NO way for Cheesecake Factory to keep this place clean. None of servers cared about it.

These pigeons walked around to find foods, SAT ON THE TABLE even if there was no food (I saw them touching empty plates that was set for next customers), ATE LEFTOVERS(servers didn't take them away for so long), flew above your head & foods....etc. It was really, really gross. I strongly recommend you to sit inside if you want to enjoy your lunch/dinner.

And what about foods?

- fried mac and cheese : comes with 4 balls of fried mac and cheese. crispy enough and it wasn't too greasy or cheesy thanks to tomato sauce that came with. Pretty good.

- avocado salad(?) : baaaaad....i could taste that avocado and greens were not fresh at all. Tortilla chips tasted weird too. I would never get this again, or at least not from this location. I left 70% of it.

- chicken salad : I don't have a picture but this is what my moma got. She said chicken was too hard that she left all of them. 

Overall, super baaaaad....! My sister got pepperoni pizza and popa got a burger and both of them looked okay. Not sure about taste as I didn't try.
author: Kim P.

description: Really, really bad! This location is beyond awful. Service is TERRIBLE, food is similar to Burger King if that's what you're looking for.
author: Randall F.

description: Their Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane with mashed potatoes are to die for.  Go look out the balcony when you're waiting to be seated.  Its so romantic and cute to see the Union Square views at night especially during Christmas time.  It's not the typical Cheesecake Factory because of the city view and union square experience.
author: Amy T.

description: Bad service, bad management, bad staff, hair in my food. Waiter couldn't refill my water or do shit for service. This place is full of bads. Don't expect any of my money or anyone I know to come to this place.
author: Mauricio B.

description:
We've got lots of Cheesecake Factories in the Bay Area. What's so special about this one? 8th floor outdoor rooftop of Macy's in DT SF, that's what! The view of union square is worth the wait, doesn't matter if you're a tourist or local. Heating lamps for those always cold folks or opt for dining indoors. Take the special elevator directly up or save time waiting and use 7 sets of escalators to view what Macy's women's/home has to offer. Take note of Starbucks on the 4th floor, Burger Bar on the 6th, and Boudin/Jamba/etc. in the basement.

35 min wait for two at 9pm Saturday night for outdoor seating! Time went by relatively fast but boy was the atrium packed! There was one rude hostess that obviously needed to go home and take a chill pill, but everyone else was polite. Someone probably told her to take a break cuz she disappeared for 20 min. Sometimes I forget how many tourists there are in the city; hosts ask for a US phone # and many didn't have one. Another observation: the bill holder has a card explaining customary tips in the US. Must be nice for servers to be paid better than minimum wage in the U.K. and elsewhere.

Patrizah A. took great care of us-- super sweet and cheerful with a genuine smile, checked back at the right times and offered cheesecake recommendations since they discontinued white chocolate blueberry. The new cold brew Coffee & Cream Chocolate Supreme is a hit with caffeine lovers. Ultimate Red Velvet!

Window seats! Our original table wasn't clean so we got better ones on the left side with fewer people around. Those seats got filled right before we left at 11! 12:30am closing time on weekends. 

Food! I tried something new but similar to my Chicken Bellagio. Ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta with crisp coated thinly pound chicken atop mildly spicy bow tie Cajun pasta with mushrooms and bell peppers. Yum! Couldn't finish this 2200 cal dish (oh heck no, half was for the next day) since I cleaned out my little Caesar salad and indulged in calamari. Sophie N. got the Angel hair pasta with shrimp, asparagus add on. Succulent shrimp! Strange how this dish is listed as Garlic Lemon Shrimp online, asparagus already added in.

Excellent experience on the rooftop once again-- I hope it stays that way! Have patience and if you're so hungry you whine while in line, do everyone a favor and grab a snack downstairs in the basement, or mobile order some Starbucks!
author: Kristine F.

description: Wow there a lot of moving parts in this machine it can be a bit confusing from entering and getting a table. After being seated you'll get your water and bread which is amazing and warm but make sure you get the butter.  Wait staff is basically come and go your have to ask for refills on anything they are busy so you may have to have them clear your table from time to time. They will press you to order your meal?  While sitting waiting for the second round of appetizers 10min plus now we are being assured they are coming it's ok take your time and with the second round of drinks, we are only adding to our order. It's so sad to say I will not be back I'm kinda embarrassed we brought some people from out of town.
author: RICHARD J.

description:
I came here for a late lunch and it was busy, but we were able to be seated right away on the heated patio which overlooks downtown San Francisco. 

I got the crab dip which I wanted both pita and chips to eat with but the server was really perplexed by this request and gave me a little bit of attitude... like, there's clearly chips on the menu. If it's an issue then say so, no need to be passive aggressive! 

After sharing the dip which was slightly impressive, my friend got an Oreo cheesecake while I got a peanut butter one. While we're both insane eaters we thought they were too dense for one slice each and agreed that we could have just shared one! They were both delicious though.
author: Julie N.

description:
This is the best place ever I literally dream about eating cheesecake in my sleep.

Food 6/5
Ambiance 6/5 
Service 5/5 
Cheesecake 6/5

LOVE IT 4 EVR
author: Sherry C.

description: Very touristy. Fortunately had the chance to sit on the balcony during the sunset. Awesome view and experience there. The wait is long at peak times. And the staff are nice but service is slow. We always get the same food at every cheesecake factory - chipotle burger with aoli sauce, pasta vino (i forgot how to spell it out, sorry!), and our hersheys chocolate cheesecake. You can't mess up on the cakes, but i wish the main meals were not rushed like they were only cooked for a few minutes with the burners very high... the pasta was very dry - had to ask for more sauce, while the burger was more on the burnt side, but meh, this location is a tourist area, so we werent surprised. We were here mostly just for the dessert anyways. Not bad though. But food is better at other locations.
author: Beatrice T.

description: Terrible experience today.  I would give zero stars if I could.  We waited for over an hour for our meal and our server was MIA.  We were served our daughters dish first then waited another 15-20 minutes for our two other plates.  When finally served, one dish had a curly white hair in it.  Of course we were not charged for this plate and didn't want to wait another hour for a new one.  The manger comes and apologizes for the experience.  He was awkward and seemed to have no service recovery skills.  Our waiter then spills a large glass of ice water onto the table, all over our daughters plate, and her shoes.  Half of her meal was soaked with water.  The manager again comes over to apologize with no further compensation for the experience that continued to get worse.  I could go on and on with details but needless to say we will not return.  Customer service is not what it should be.
author: Sara H.

description: Long, long wait times. The hostess confused the number of ppl in our party which prolonged the wait. After waiting what seemed like an eternity half of our party decided to leave so they ordered cheesecakes to go. My hunger has grown immensely at this point so I tested a cheesecake the vanilla bean one I believe. Now, although I saw the employees restocking the cheesecake periodically I automatically assumed they were made freshly as they run out but no the cheesecake tasted stale as ever!! I variety of flavors were ordered but the vanilla bean was the only one I tried and it was not fresh
author: Love L.

description:
I only want a slice of cheesecake, but why does this specific location makes ordering a slice so difficult? Oh wait... That's right! It's the ultimate tourist trap for all travelers and locals alike!

Location:

You can find the restaurant at the tippy top floor of the Macy's within San Francisco's Union Square. Just take an elevator and enjoy the 45 seconds of awkward silence as the elevator rushes people to the top. From there you will find a dimmed restaurant with thousands of tourists and disgruntled employees. On the other hand, good luck finding parking! Your best bet is to park inside one of the parking garages unless you're daring enough to walk 5-10 blocks from the area. Be prepared with some cash as some parking places take cash only.

Setting:

As I mentioned before, the CCF is at the tippy top floor of the gigantic Macy's. This place is great for a h-angry someone who ADORES waiting 20-120 minutes for a seat to dine-in. Not to mention ordering a slice of cheesecake to-go can be just as long as waiting for a seat to dine-in. While the views at the top are spectacular during the night time, there's seating inside of the restaurant and on the outdoor balcony. While this restaurant is noisy full of chatter from different patrons, if you're looking for a quiet and romantic dinner, I highly suggest you look elsewhere.

Customer Service:

I feel the pain for the employees who have to work twice as hard to ensure everyone is happy. However, I have to give them kudos for working at the busiest CCF on the planet. Despite all the patrons coming in and out of the restaurant, they do a pretty decent job at handling the crowd. On the other hand, if you only want a slice of cheesecake to-go, I recommend ordering through the phone instead of waiting in line to order something.

Food:

I only have the Chocolate Macadamia slice of cheesecake. It was BOMB, smooth, and nutty. Even though there's a HUGE chunk of whipped cream on the side, the cheesecake itself is best shared with two people. On the other hand, for the $8-9 a slice, it would be a better option to find a dessert place who sells the same thing at a lower price.

Overall:

Despite the high prices, tourists, and all the crazy schemes happening at this CCF location, I'll give it a plus for the views at the top. However, if I were you, I'd find somewhere else to eat in SF that serves decent cheesecake at a lower price.
author: Aubrey D.

description: Liked the place, the banana cheesecake was delicious, the price is not that expensive. Beautiful view from patio.
author: Botirali M.

description:
Cheesecake factory is pretty standard, and this location is extremely crowded. They don't have reservations, so on a Saturday night in December the wait was 1.5-2 hours for 2 people!! Bar is open seating though, so we sat there.

I got a martini to drink, which was really good and had blue cheese stuffed olives NOM. For my main dish, I got the angel hair pasta with shrimp. I've had it before, it's only okay. Not super flavorful and the shrimp was definitely overcooked. However, I love the thinness of angel hair pasta.

My boyfriend got the chicken and shrimp curry which I tried. It was pretty good, but heavy. I couldn't eat a whole plate of it.

Overall, Cheesecake Factory is a good place for a not too expensive meal, so great for families. They have a large variety on the menu too, but it's not the best for food snobs. Also their pumpernickel bread is bomb!!
author: Jenna G.

description:
Perfect as usual..back to this place again.Nice view.Food is always great.Cheese cakes are awesome.Service  is superb.

 Every time I visit San Francisco. I have to come to this location. LOVE IT!
author: Supawat J.

description:
Was my daily dinner joint while on business in SF.
Place is a favorite of the people (locals and tourists) with huge crowds of 100s of people at the restaurant at a time. Restaurant is very well managed (kudos to the team) and its amazing how well they are able to take such good care of their customers from table allocations to quickly cleaning up tables with crew assigned to that specific task. 
This is one location that is definitely worth the 20-30mins wait for a table. Food is delicious with many food options, arrived fast, service was exceptional.
author: S R.

description:
Great value for lunch!

I had in my FB feed that yesterday & today were 1/2 price cheesecake day. I was in  worried that it would be a mad house/super crowded.

2 co-workers and I hatched a plan to leave the office at 11:25am on a Monday to get to Union Square to beat the lunch rush.

The way they seat is annoying - you put your name and number in and they give you a buzzer. then when the buzzer goes off you mingle by the hostess desk until they can seat you (so really 2 separate waits  to be seated) - we were waiting particularly long on the 2nd wait (about 2 feet from the hostess desk) - so we asked - sure enough someone else impersonated us and took our seating. (I will say it is very touristy, and loads of non-English-speaking tourists, so maybe an honest mistake by one of them).
