But as soon as we asked about our name we were seated. The lunch specials are a good deal - my entrée was $14.50 and enough for 3 meals. The chicken parmesan pizza (really just a round shaped chicken cutlet (very thin) with cheese and sauce and some angel hair on top.  

The bread at your table is very very good, a brown bread and a sourdough, both warm served with butter.

It would be great if they kept things like sweet & low and ketchup on the table since it was a bit of trouble to flag down wait staff (3x for the ketchup for my friend).  

But the super nice thing was that when we all put in a credit card for the bill - rather than the usual (split it 3 equal ways - our waitress actually split it by what we ordered -- wahoo! mine was cheapest).

I got the banana cream cheesecake (so MANY choices of cheesecake, all 1/2 price on this day) - Next time I am going for the Oreo, which looked great. It was $20.95 for a filling entrée and dessert - with loads of leftovers

I would happy go here 1x per year for a meal and a 1/2 price slice of cheesecake.
author: Amy W.

description:
This place has a HUGE selection and once again I over ate! the pigeons on the table next to us appeared to enjoy their meal as well.. Lol
  our server was very nice ! We sat out on the terrace which was great!
author: Jim E.

description:
I know most cities have a Cheesecake Factory so if you don't want to eat here, come here for a drink and the view. 

This particular location is nestled right no top of Macy's in the middle of Union Square. They have an outside patio that looks out and gives you a pretty spectacular view, especially at night when everything is lit up. 

The menu has about everything you could ever imagine. One of my favorites is the Chicken Bellagio. It's a really delicious chicken pesto dish. Hard to find these days. The drinks are always great and it's all reasonably priced. Of course, there will be a wait. We usually try to find a spot at the bar since it's first come first serve. If it is your first time visiting here, wait for the patio. The atmosphere is worth it all.
author: Zoe F.

description:
I don't have any complaints about this place. The food is always great! I sometimes like having dessert before my meal and I love the idea of cheese cake before dinner! I their pasta, their bread but honestly I enjoy their chocolate cake the most. It's just so rich and creamy but not overwhelming what so ever. 

This branch particularly is extremely busy Bc it's in the heart of union square. Plus I feel like everyone also wants to go up to sit in the outside patio for the amazing view. Yes there is a wait, but you have to anticipate it! Especially in the union square, aka tourist fiasco. The staff honestly does the most, they have to deal with so much tourists on top on their local customers and it's honestly so busy all the time. I give props to them.
author: Angelique J.

description: One of my most favorite dessert restaurants. Their wide variety of cheesecakes available is satisfying for ever taste bud. I highly recommend their s'mores cheesecake. This is a busy restaurant as it's in the middle of union square. It's always a huge wait to get a seat. Be prepared. They do have a lovely view of San Fran from their outdoor seating. I have had their avocado egg rolls a million times and it's a family favorite. There are no eggs in it by the way. It's served with this lovely dip on the side as well. I prefer their pastas as main course. All in all I've had good times here.
author: Julia J.

description:
We've come here two years in a row for the Union Square Tree Lighting. Last year we went after the lighting and this year we went before. So I can only speak to their service and food on what is probably their busiest day of the year. They're located on the 8th Floor of the MACY's in Union Square. You can either take the escalators or take the shorter way up the elevator. 

It is ridiculously busy when you get to the lobby. The wait is long. Like 1.5 to 2 hours long and that's just "first available," so there is no guarantee you're going to make it to the outside balcony that oversees the tree and the ice skating rink. 

We've always eaten in the bar area, tonight right at the bar. The bartenders were fantastic. They're attentive and polite even though they're being pulled in every direction. I was also able to watch them interact with other customers and they were friendly and efficient with everyone. 

The portions are very big. But the prices are affordable, especially for the amount of food. The bread they bring out before the meal is amazing! It's a wheat bread of some sort (maybe honey wheat) and it's warm. It was the perfect snack to hold us over till our meals came. 

I love the festivity of this area around this time of year so it's a great spot to try during the holidays. What I would suggest, and may do in the future, is to come on a not-so-busy day and sit outside and enjoy the tree and skating from above. Someday I'd actually like to sit out there and get the full experience, but that day will never be on a Black Friday.
author: Christine B.

description: It's always a great time at The Cheesecake Factory! We went on a Monday evening around 7pm and wait time for four people was about 15 min to sit inside and getting seated right away if we wanted the outside. It was a bit chilly so it made sense why people would prefer the inside. Our food arrived fairly quickly and in the mean time we had crab bites with mustard sauce which were just delicious. Our food was pretty great! We had no complaints whatsoever and our server was really attentive. We went for a birthday and we surprised the birthday boy with a black out cake to sing happy birthday and the staff made the experience pretty memorable. They got everyone else around involved and made it a special day for my friend. Would definitely recommend this location. The staff is great and the food is always pretty solid.
author: Melanie L.

description: So good! Everything was delicious. They have so many choices for you guys. This time we got pasta with chicken, orange chicken and ahi poke (I believed) and two appetizers was tuna tartare and fried calamari.
author: Kanjana N.

description: Good but not awesome. It's real popular we wait for half an hour on a Monday night. The dishes are above average but the view from the union square is excellent. Recommend Oreo Cheesecake!
author: Ziyue M.

description:
Giant. Giant giant plates. Wow. 

I can eat here for ever !  So much food. 
I got some type of chicken with potato. And my friend got eggplant with pasta. 
Tasty.  
Service is rock.  Food is very good. 
The place so well done.
My first time. And not my last. 

Server is so nice. Polite. Quick.
author: Amber D.

description:
If I'm turning to a higher scale American food, cheesecake is always my go to. It's a little on the pricey side but definitely worth it in my opinion. The SF location gets pretty packed, so expect to wait 30min before sitting at a table unless you sit at the bar. They have a nice outdoor seating area, which is perfect for a beautiful sunny day in the city with a great view of union square. 

Their drinks are delicious, my fav is the Long Island iced tea! Complimentary bread is always great, especially the darker bread! I usually order the herb crusted salmon and it always hits the spot! It sits on top of mashed potatoes and is a generous portion! We came here for my cousins birthday and one of the waiters is always dressed in a playful hat And ready to sing happy birthday! It's great seeing him love what he does and lifts up the spirits in the room!
author: Clarissa C.

description: I was there today with my family. There were 3 of us. Our food took forever to come out. The dishes were brought out 10 mins apart. Unacceptable. By the time my food came out my husband and daughter were done eating. We've been here several times when visiting SF but won't be coming here any time soon. They weren't even busy.
author: Nikki A.

description:
The Cheesecake Factory has always been one of my favorite chain restaurants. This particular one is extra nice because it's located on the top floor of Macy's which overlooks Union Square. The view up here is absolutely amazing. With that said, this also means it's quite a touristy spot and it's crazy crowded. They gave a buzzer for when your table is ready, which allowed us to wander around the floors only to wait some more even after our buzzer went off. It's a Monday night and somehow still incredibly packed.

We ended up sitting inside, which got quite stuffy. It also didn't help with how hot it got as we shared a bottle of wine. One of my favorites here has to be their complimentary bread, especially the honey oat one --yum! Make sure to ask for extra of those. Between the two of us, we ordered to share the Crab Cake Bites ($8), Louisiana Chicken Pasta ($18), and Steak Diane ($29). Everything was yummy and came in huge portions! I know the menu gets intimidating here, but my go-to has and will always be the Louisiana Chicken Pasta.

Since we were so stuffed, it didn't leave us room for the cheesecake. Yet, we still got a complimentary ice cream since it was my birthday. This is still one of my favorite spots though!
author: Cindy Z.

description: Wasn't bad. Food was okay, but service just took forever. We were seated but it felt like we waited half an hour before we got our order in. Food came out at an expected time but getting the check and trying to order a cheesecake after that also took a while. Overall, a meh experience.
author: Thomas C.

description: Ordered the tiramisu and chocolate cake from here last night as this was the only place shown as open in doordash. OMG both were amazing.tiramisu was moist enough and chocolate cake when warmed was delicious too.
author: Prerna M.

description:
The Cheesecake Factory is a longstanding establishment of Union Square. Perched on top of the Macy's building, this restaurant has served countless tourists, shoppers and locals alike for decades. 

If what you value in a restaurant is consistency, heaping portions, extremely long lines or you just feel a hankering to scarf down some cheesecake, come early and get your spot in the Cheesecake Factory and tour around Union Square until your table is ready!
author: Tyler W.

description: Top of the Macy's building. Long waits but worth the views to dine outside over Union Square. Of course good food and cheesecake. Staff is great, well paid so better than most.
author: John O.

description:
I've eaten here for years - probably 30 times or more. It's our go-to place when we are shopping in the city because it's easy and there are lots of choices. I loved this place until the last three times we've eaten here, which have all been bad. So, after our last visit here this weekend I think we won't be coming back again. Sad. We had bad service and bad food. I wouldn't normally give this place a one star review but it was bad three times in a row. UGH. 

The service was SLOW. And our server (Glendi? not sure of her name) was bored by our presence and totally inefficient. We asked for water, and she brought one. Had to ask for another one. She never asked if I wanted another drink after I finished my drink. She didn't refill ice tea until asked. Just totally nonchalant about everything. I would give the service a D. But, and the end when she brought our bill, she made sure to put a notation on the receipt that "tip is not included." Duh. And rude. 

My husband ordered the club sandwich. It was DRY AS A BONE. Burnt toast that looked and tasted like it had been under the warmer far too long. (C'mon, how do you ruin a club sandwich?) I ordered the Orange Chicken with rice and vegetables. Basically, we all know that this is breaded fried chicken pieces that they put in different sauces so I know what I'm getting. I've ordered it before also. Well, the chicken was also DRY AS A BONE. It looked like they drizzled a tiny bit of orange sauce over the chicken after it was already on the plate. Weird right??? So I waited 10-15 minutes for her to come back and I asked for a side of orange chicken sauce to put on my food. She comes back with this dish of sauce that had EXACTLY one teaspoon of extra sauce. I'm not even kidding. So I gave up. And I gnawed on my chicken. Gross. 

We had two lunch entrees, two pieces of cheesecake, on daiquiri and one ice tea. It was $75.00. 

NO. NO. NO.
author: Wanda G.

description: Enjoying good food wirh good people. The waitress was awesome as she engaged with us a lot. I'll be back!!
author: Tim J.

description:
I actually really like Cheesecake Factory restaurants... been going since high school when they first opened up in Vegas. You always know what you're going to get.

Unfortunately this location was super disappointing.

Not only was I put on hold to even place my to-go order, they never picked up! So I walked over there from my hotel and waited.

Just got an orange chicken which I've gotten many many times.

The place was a mad house. People everywhere, no order amongst the chaos and it was so warm in there.

My food didn't take too long but it ended up being super dry, over cooked and lacking that nice orange flavored sauce. Didn't taste like orange at all.

I guess I really didn't know what I was getting at this location. Boooo.
author: M L.

description:
I absolutely love this Cheesecake Factory. 
I usually sit at the bar and have a drink and eat. I truly love the Cheesecake Factory just because it literally has everything - EVERYTHING. It's amazing. 
Goes from burrito, to chicken pot pie, to burger to orange chicken, to fish tacos, biscuits and gravy, fish n chips - I think you get the picture here.  
Reason number 2 is consistency - no matter what day, or hour ... your food will always be delicious. 

They have a great bar! I have never had a bad drink here. 
I often order drinks with tonic and have never felt my drink was "weak" or not to measure. 

If you come here and have never tried an item you want to try ... do it. Take a leap of faith. 
Anything you order will be a fair representation or standard of how it should probably taste.
author: Steve S.

description: I usually like going to cheesecake factory but I particularly did not like my recent experience here. After waiting for an hour we were escorted to our seats. After getting our seats we were asked by the manager "you cannot walk in directly. You have to check in". I don't think I would want to be in such an awkward situation right before my dinner
author: Tejal N.

description:
This review is strictly for this location and for take out. I ordered my 10 inch  cheesecake for pickup at 4:00pm. So i arrived and the cashier could not find my order, gave my order number took 10 mins. And then he finds out the cake was not ready. The message was not written on the cake. 
Their service here truly blows, if you're a local you would never come here. Tourist would love it here. So then the cashier would give change to the waiters and waitress. And give excuses like " oh we're backed up right now". Heres the thing own up to your mistakes and fix it. Theirs one cashier and everyone just standing around, how does that make sense?.
author: Curry S.

description:
The food is always good (or consistent would be more appropriate) and the venue is always buzzing. The rating is for the consistently poor service and the apathy towards loyal customers.

My mother and I arrived around 830 pm on 09/04, ie, Tuesday evening. After waiting for an hour, we were seated outside and were served by Piedra. The food arrived stone cold and no water was offered. The waiter never came around to collect feedback. However, this isn't the worst part of the story.

It was my mother's birthday and I had informed the server, to which he said - we'll make it special. After waiting an eternity, when I was forced to summon him, he said - we are very short staffed today and we can't offer any frills! I was shocked and disappointed at this rude explanation, although this has been a fairly typical feature of this particular venue.

Arrogance based on success can prove to be very costly in the long run, and I hope this venue doesn't fall into that trap.
author: Aditya M.

description:
I have been a Cheesecake loyalist until now. Like the restaurants in Chicago, Fort Worth, Bellevue. But something is not right with their restaurants in Bay Area. The one in Palo Alto was a bad experience but I chose to ignore it under assumption that it was a long weekend and they might have been short staffed. This one in union square is even worse. To avoid long wait, the husband & I sat at the bar. It smelled of alcohol and something sweet but hey that's what you get for sitting at a bar right? Let's get to food now, shall we. I ordered a California guacamole salad that I have tried at least 50 times but never has it been so flavorless. The husband ordered Bang Bang shrimp and chicken which is usually a crowd pleaser and generally dependable in terms of taste and flavor but we were wrong. It tasted mediocre, the curry flavor was missing. The reason I go to cheesecake is because I find their food consistently tasty but if it's not going to maintain that then we will take our business elsewhere. This, from a couple who eat at least once a week in cheesecake. 
The bartender was good. His energy was the reason we stayed until the end of our meal and the reason for one star.
author: Finla P.

description:
GF Godiva chocolate and GF Coffee flavored 
GLUTEN FREE cheesecake sold BY THE SLICE at the To GO counter - with a view of union square.

super nice and patient staff at the TO GO counter even with a lot of people waiting, I didn't feel rushed to make a decision and they were quick to point out the GF options on the menu for me. 

what's not to love????? thank you cheesecake factory!!
author: Win H.

description: This is my second time here and both times I had an issue will not be here for a third. The first time there was a hair in my food and by the time they brought be a fresh plate while I was full off of my friends plates. Second time they forgot to put my order in altogether and I got full off my friends food AGAIN while they brought my food out 20 minutes later. And we witnessed a waiter and a host ignore this family next to us. Such bad service. They need more staff for this popular location.
author: Rahanna A.

description:
Perfect location with amazing view of union Sq ..
Restaurant can be way overcrowded with a waiting line longer than two hours .
Staff is friendly ., food is good ., but the only thing that makes me give 4 stars is the waiting time for the food ., can take longer than 45m
author: Sase S.

description:
Just keep words simple : rude , disrespectful , terrible service, bad attitude , no Manner and racist .

Anyone who get a chance to eat here beware of this lady .
author: Ken Z.

description: Love the Cheesecake Factory, but this location was not up to par. Food was good, service was quick. But the tables looked dirty, place setting looked dirty. The waiter wasn't friendly, we noticed right off the bar when we noticed the customer next to us being rushed out. Great location, right in Union Square. It's a safe bet for food (we didn't want to try anything new, wanted something familiar) but won't go back there!
author: Francesca C.

description:
Based on experience of Sunday dinner:

Pros
1. Awesome view of Union Square in SF seating outside
2. Amazing food for Vegetarian
- Loved Lasagna Verde and Guacamole Toast (recommended by our server)
3. Awesome drinks
- Mojito was perfectly mixed 
4. Fantastic server
- Our server was Noah on Sun 3/18 for outside seating
- The best customer service provided by him
5. Price
- Reasonable based on quality, portion and ambience
6. Provides many deals for cheesecake all around the year

Cons (given based on nature of life in SF)
1. No reservation
- Wait was about 40-45 min on Sunday eve. at 7.15 pm
2. Difficult to find parking
 
Overall, we were glad that we went to this Cheesecake. Definitely recommended.
author: Neel S.

description:
I love this cheesecake factory location; especially the dinning patio outside overlooking Union Square.

The food is consistent, the menu varied, and service is always pleasant and helpful.

Prices are pretty reasonable for the portion and quality. BTW they have now listed the calories for each dish......dam....1900 calories?  that is a whole days worth....yikes!!!!

Wait times are insane so be prepared for at least an hour to two hours wait on busy nights.

Great bar...and dont forget their amazing cheesecakes....god they are good!
author: David G.

description: Will always have a line and wait time. You take the elevator up from Macy's. They do have outside dining with a view of Union Square but the restaurant itself is already large!
author: Steven W.

description:
Cheesecake Factory is what it is...you know exactly what you'll get when you visit one, and this one is no exception.  The menu is reliable, and the service friendly at this location.   I suppose the stellar star would be the view from the outdoor patio tables, as you're in the skyseats over Union Square.  (This one is filled to the brim with tourists-not that that's bad, but you know the drill.)

We had a regular 2 person, middle of the row half booth, which was fine.  Our wait was about 40 minutes on a Thursday night-there is usually a crowd lined up to put a name in for a table...so be ready to hang out a bit.  There aren't a ton of seats to wait on, so mostly people just stand around all over the place around the desk-which looks like madness.

All in all, I'd definitely pop in again for a slice of cheesecake to go from the bakery counter.  (I do like the banana one!)   For dinner though, unless I was craving a certain Cheesecake Factory specialty, I'd probably just go somewhere more local in the area...there are tons of great restaurants on every street around Union Square.  :)

Have fun!

TIP:
*  You can only put your name in the queue in person, so first come, first seated.

* I don't know what the new Cakepay app is for, except for linking your payment cards, as it won't hold you a place in line...but while you wait, feel free to download it from the app store and fiddle around with it, you have time on your hands-LOL!

*Use the Macy's escalators to the 8th floor to get right up to the checkin counter or if you can cram in, the elevator also goes right there...
author: Diana W.

description:
We had guests in from Michigan so we wanted a bite to eat before taking them to the airport. We got seated quickly which was great! It was a bit warm in the restaurant but anyways after taking our order and waiting a while to get our food which is understandable the waiter came out with 3 of the 4 orders. I guess there was a misunderstanding and one of the orders was never put in. I do believe it was an innocent misunderstanding, which was fine theses things happen. So the Order was later put in but due to our time crunch to get to the airport we just took the last order to go. We got an apology from the waiter and the manager which was nice. But you would think that for that kind of mistake they would leave that order off the bill, but they didn't, we ended up paying for it. 

Cheese cake factory is known for its large portions! But after receiving the Togo box I noticed that it wasn't the portion size I've known cheesecake factory to be which was a bit disappointing. 

Maybe it wasn't our day, hopefully a better experience next time!

But the seating outside is an amazing view of union square!
author: Al H.

description: I am not sure what all the hype is about to be honest. Food is good, not great. Portions are humongous. We were there on a Friday at 5pm and there was a 35 minute wait for a table already, so we just ordered it to go. Huge menu, cheesecakes are also good. I would say it's average, but there are better places to go.
author: Laura R.

description: I don't know what the negativity is about here. The Cheesecake Factory has got decent food at an affordable price (given that you are likely to box the rest of your leftovers for another meal). I've always been a fan of Cheesecake Factories across for their consistency (the Louisiana chicken pasta being my girlfriend and my personal favorite menu item), but the San Francisco locations got a very nice view on the balcony level (bring a hat and some shades). There was enough seating for us to be accommodated despite the busy rush hour of diners.
author: David Y.

description: Second visit! Really love the cheesecake! Creamy and rich! Also I have Wellness Salad. The salad is full of veggies and berries. Avocado adds much more flavor to it. But I have to point out that the broccoli is not fresh enough because it turns to brown. I have waited about 30 minuets to get our table and another 20 minuets to have food. Sam is our waiter and he is so nice! Thanks! I am coming back again!
author: Gigi G.

description: This restaurant is one of my favorites, the taste consistency of all their restaurants is very good and great portions for the price. Pastas are my favorite and they fill you up! Their warm brown bread is a must try brought out to you when you're seated
author: Alyssa V.

description:
This place has such horrible customer service. Just celebrated our girlfriends birthday and it was a complete mood killer experience. We had girlfriends joining us from 2 hours away from San Francisco to join us for dinner. We were first quoted 1 1/2 wait to be seated which was expected. 

It turned out to be a 2 hour wait. Took and additional 45 minutes for our food to arrive after being seated. Wait it gets better!!!!

One of our girlfriends was missing her pasta dish! Her food came 30 minutes after into our meal. 2 of our meals tasted like slop! Watery no flavored pasta. 

When we asked our server her had no idea that she was even missing her food. We then asked for the manager. 

"Manager Mike "comes over to our table. Unconcerned, short, rude and honestly he didn't care at all that we were unhappy. We told him about the watery pasta, missing soup and our friends missing dish, (at this point I'm already done with my food) He did not care and did not apologize. 

Don't get me wrong this place has great cheesecake but it is not worth the wait and costumer service sucks! 

If you're hungry don't come here! Stay away not worth it!
author: Rox N.

description:
1/29And Im still waiting for them to get back to me.
I see you guys responding to other reviews, what gives?


---
We received very poor service from our server Oscar. We waited for 20 minutes for him to come, he was in the table in front of us flirting with two young ladies that seemed very uncomfortable with his solicitation of their personal information. 

When he finally came to get our order he used vulgar unprofessional language. He referred to my father as "yo what you want old man." And to me "what about you ma?".

We requested a different  server. A manager came and assured we would be taken care of. This didn't stop Oscar from making us feel uncomfortable.

As we waited for our food he walked by and made various  comments, "awkward, why are they here, people run their mouths, ugh," and so on. 

Our food came in. The last entree came in 25 minutes after the first one: the food was not well cooked. This we understand, busy day. What follows, not so much.

We waited for our bill to come and Oscar, sitting with other servers at a table nearby, was yelling "why are these people here, they should go home." We paid our bill and for obvious reasons left ZERO tip. 

We walk to the elevator and Oscar yells our way, "They left no damn tip, wow!".

I proceeded to take my daughter outside to see the view from the 8th floor. Then Oscar comes and mockingly yells "happy new year!". This made my entire family-- especially my daughter feel very uncomfortable. My father tells him to leave us alone. Oscar runs back to the table with the other servers. I ask for the manager. At this point Oscar gets violent and begins to yell at my father. Servers hold Oscar back. 

Once the manager arrives, I demand a refund. Oscar's behavior is unacceptable. The manager assures I will receive a call and takes down my information.

While I completely understand that Holidays are extremely busy days and the waiting times and even food quality may be compromised, patrons should not be subjected to harassment. We are regular patrons of this location and the one in Corte Madera and always recommend the restaurant to friends and family, especially people visiting from out of town. We don't feel comfortable coming back though.

This experience ruined our New Years Eve dinner. 

Already filled out the form on the website. Waiting to hear back from Mr. Kiernan. 

Stars for the second server, she was cool. Sorr
author: Ara L.

description:
I've been to the Cheesecake Factory in many other places but this experience is the worst. The seat we sat in had a pungent smell of vomit... we were not sure if it was the floor or the seats that smelled, but the smell bothered us a lot. The place was very packed at that time so we could not change another seat without waiting for another 30 minutes  (we already waited for almost an hour just to get seated). The service was nice and the food was as expected, so I would recommend others to just sit outside for the fresh air. Eating under that gross smell was a nightmare! They really need to work on their cleaning.
Note: if any one cares, the seat was on the left wing. So maybe you can avoid the tragic experience by sitting in the right wing.
Also, I don't know what's wrong with their cheesecake... it was bloody salty. I had to drink water when I eat the cake.
author: Sophie L.

description:
Ok so I RARELY review chains, mainly because I try and avoid them as much as possible. 

I have not been to a Cheesecake Factory in maybe 12 years or so and was hesitant. But, friends wanted to go and there are not a ton of family friendly options downtown SF. So, we went. First, the line was INSANE. Like 1.5 hours for a table. Not sure if it's regularly that bad or because it was holiday weekend. We got a table outside quicker because we were fine with it. We could suffer through the cold. 

The menu is ridiculous. They have everything. And lots of it. We decided to go all in and eat junky. We had a few fried appetizers then decided on burgers and fries. We're vegetarian but they substituted veggie burgers into another burger combo with no problems. It was fantastically unhealthy food. 

Feeling absolutely stuffed, we still got a slice of cheesecake which is the size of a full meal there! 

I'd 100% go back if we were in sf and we're craving a spot like this. Great view of Union Square as well. 

Great times and more than OK food!
author: Sean M.

description:
this place absolutley SUCKS. i never write reviews but im PIST OFF because these people cant ever get a burger right...
good job guys 
i swear this is the 5th time ((i kid you not)) that i have came here and every single time something happens with my BURGER
author: Kayla S.

description:
Listen, the only reason I really came here was because I was getting cash back on a credit/bank card (lol), but I have to agree with most; the service is lacking. But that's primarily because these arrogant workers are so used to clueless tourists and visitors just throwing money at them all because of the name brand and all because of the location, so they don't take pride in their customer service positions. They EXPECT business to always be busy and they EXPECT patrons to pay a lot of money and tip them no matter what the conditions are. That's the problem with most places these days. Luckily my recent visit wasn't all too bad. 

I placed the to-go order over the phone for Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, some type of smoked or spicy penne pasta with chicken I think (forgot what it was called), and two slices of cheesecake (and NO I didn't order all that food just to eat in one setting. I wanted enough for leftovers to eat over the next few days so I wouldn't have to cook. Busy week lol). Getting to the 8th floor is a bit of a hassle, you have to wait for the stupid elevator which is always crowded. There is definitely confusion on where exactly to pick up to-go orders so be sure to not be afraid to sternly make one of the 500 servers walking around doing nothing direct you where you need to go. By time I finally got the food and could bumrush to the front of the elevator line to hurry back down to the 1st floor, I was happy. The pastas were mediocre at best of course, but the CHEESECAKE, wow let me tell you, I was actually surprised at how good the cheesecake was. 

I had a slice of the Red Velvet, and a slice of their 30th anniversary special cheesecake that was like a vanilla and chocolate marble mix. Both were SO creamy, SO decadent, SO delicious. And the question to be asked is why would you go to The Cheesecake Factory for anything other than cheesecake? In fact, they should stop trying to outdo themselves by having such a complicated menu and just serve Cheesecake and coffee only because their lack of organization (at this location especially) doesn't help anybody. 

4 stars for the cheesecake ONLY. Oh, and 4 stars because the pasta portions for to-go were quite HUGE, considering the price. I hope they are like that everytime.
author: Marquis A.

description:
My favorite cheesecake factory by far! 

I don't know if it's the amazing view at this cheesecake factory but I just love coming here.

The food is always good but the cheesecake is sooooo good! 

Tonight I had shrimp fettuccine Alfredo and it was delicious, I also had my favorite drink, pineapple mule. Definitely recommend.
author: Mayumi H.

description: Came here for lunch on our last day in San Francisco and it was the perfect place to enjoy a farewell meal. Two of us had the Californian omelette and one the breakfast burrito. Delicious and huge portions! The service was great and we sat outside on the terrace enjoying the sunshine and the sounds of Union Square. We arrived about 12.30 and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. At the end of the meal we shared a cheesecake - choosing one out of the long list was hard to do! The menu is long and varied and I'm sure everyone would find something they like.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Had early dinner here
Was discusting mike the manager was 
Not believing that there was nat in the rice 
He did remove the meal but had a bad attitude 
And said that just got inspected I guess that was his way to say there  washout nats
author: Mike M.

description:
No no no. Nice view if you wanna come and just take a picture. Would be nice to seat and grab a drink or a cheese cake but that would take you 3 hours of waiting.
The food is not good at all. My shrimp angel hair pasta was without pasta, 4 shrimps and just all the plate full of tomatoes. It was just not eatable.
author: Kira B.

description: Dirty dishes, hair in my food. None of which was my waiters fault. He was nice, just a sickening experience. I want go throw up.
author: D D.

description: I think this is a fun place with a diverse menu where everyone can find something.  The avocado egg rolls (appetizer) are great.  My only complaint is the noise level is high, but that is a common problem.  The hostess couldn't be bothered to notice us for a few minutes, but our waiter was excellent and attentive.  Prices are fair for a very high rent neighborhood.   For the quality of food, I don't think you will find lower prices very easily near Union Square.   The food is always appealing and delicious.  Decor is consistent for this restaurant.
author: Kirsten B.

description: The view is great! It's a great cuisine, me and my friends had a great time there. Recommended to family gatherings.
author: Catherine B.

description:
Lunch is good.  We always order from the skinnylicious menu.  Cheesecake, all flavors are good to.  Our only complaint is the music!  
Not sure why it needs to be turned up so loud.  My girlfriends and I are shouting at each other.  We've asked to have it lowered but nothing happens.  Even spoken to the manager and he just apologizes.  
I'm only referring to the Hillsdale location.
author: Rosemarie P.

description:
"Reviewing a cheesecake factory? I mean, come on Chris...everyone knows what those are! And don't I hear you complaining about chain casual dining all the time? I'm surprised you even went there...let alone reviewed it"

"Just read it...there's reasons..."

"FIVE STARS? Are you out of your mind?"

"Look boss, just because it's /A/ cheesecake factory doesn't mean it has to be part of a mall in suburbia filled with soccer mom's and tween birthday parties! Well, okay, there was a tween birthday party last time I was there, but...it's a rooftop bar with outdoor seating! The view of the city is amazing, and the location is fantastic."

"They paid you, didn't they..."

"Just because they had the Slice of Life promotion doesn't mean I was paid off! Anyone could get those free cheesecakes."

"Okay, well, you better fess up that the food is still unhealthy."

"That's true, no doubt, but that's actually a complaint...they seem to have scaled back on portions and up on prices. But the drinks are still a stiff pour...and the cheesecake prices seem reasonable by SF standards!"

"I guess...at least they've probably got plenty of tables."

"Yeah, but that's something to watch out for, still...anytime it's nice out this place is gonna be swamped."

"But still...five stars?!"

"The view and outdoor roottop bar alone mean I'll bring friends from out of town here sometimes...though maybe for drinks and cheesecake, not dinner...and you KNOW I only take them to the best SF has to offer!"

"Okay...MAYBE I'll let you print this, Chris...but you better investigate other SF cheesecakes too, dammit!"

"Oh no boss, not that! [MOCK TERROR]"

And scene.
author: Chris S.

description:
On the upper floor of the SF downtown Macy's lies The Cheesecake Factory. Being in such a prime location, the wait can be especially long during peak hours. I've come here twice or so over the previous year and have found it to be rather mediocre overall. 

The service was not great, but not terribly bad as well. The food however always ends up being especially bland despite its nice and flavorful appearance. Their fried appetizers are somewhat decent with good heat and crisp, but their pasta tends to be overcooked such that there is a lack of firmness. I've tried another Cheesecake Factory branch in the past and find this establishment to be quite lacking in food quality compared to it. The cheesecake here is quite disappointing as well with it being a mush that tastes of cream and sugar without much substance and depth of flavor.

The main positive of this restaurant has to be its location though. If you're able to get an outdoor seat for lunch on a nice sunny day in SF then you'll be treated to a wonderful view of union square though more often or not, there's going to be construction going on.
author: Joshua M.

description:
This is the place to go when you have endless time...and endless patience.  Always, overcrowded with longggggggg waits...average 1-1.5hrs wait for table. 

But, if you do eat here.....food surprisingly tasty.  Quantities large, service usually attentive, deserts yummy and Union Sq view is very pretty. 

The only real problem is the lack of reservation system. The crowds that rush the elevator to reach the restaurant.  The mass mayhem that greets you when reaching restaurant level. The system for this location needs to be revamped.

With that out of the way. .....on this occasion I was for fortune to get 2 seats in the bar area. We had exceptional,  EXCEPTIONAL. ...service from the bartender Charles. Placemat's immediately,  Drinks 2min later, bread order not long after, ordered crusted salmon dish and chicken reisling cream dish....both WONDERFUL!!!  Too many people cluttered in small area, but food & service was spot on exceptional. 

Thank you Charles. ... exceptional experience to be waited on by you, while you non-stop filled dtink orders. Amazing!!
author: Sharine d.

description: My  first time sitting by the glass lol, the first server did not like me requesting window seat and iam sorry about it. It was kinda empty and i wanted to take advantage of that. So lemme start by the seating arrangement, thank u so much for that. Gosh you guys have a huge selection to chose from in your menu and i loved it. Me and my husband both got chicken chilli, it tasted totally homemade and we both loved it. With the generous portion of chicken, you will definitely be full. we also oredered a side of fries, which was also a good size and very very yummy. It was a perfect weather to have a rooftop lunch. First timer so it was very very exciting, i was enjoying the food with the view. When my friend saw the pictures, she was like omg this looks like London, i was like it is our own San Francisco. Overall i had an amazing time guys. So when i requested to change the seats, our server did get changed and she was this super friendly young girl. I wish i could remember her name. But amazing job whoever u were. THANK YOU.
author: Pritika M.

description:
I'm a Cheesecake Factory fan! Okay, I'll be honest I'm a cheesecake anything fan. So, you had me at cheesecake! I don't come here frequently, maybe once or twice a year. And even though I always walk out with cheesecake to go d'oh... I usually have a meal while I'm there too. 

The location on Union Square in the heart of San Francisco makes this Cheesecake Factory maybe the busiest in the entire chain. The confusing part about this location is finding the entrance. If I recall, the actual restaurant is on the 8th floor of the historic Macy's building and you can only get there via the elevator entered at street level. I've been to this location several times and every-time there's a wait. Is it worth the wait? Probably not, but if you like cheesecake like I do then it's well worth it. It's up to you to decide. Oh, maybe this tip might help too... there's two lines (1) for the restaurant (2) for takeout. So make sure you're in the right one! 

The lunch & dinner menu is typical American grub like hamburgers, but also small plates, salads, and specialties too. Who's fooling who? It's a chain restaurant, but I admit my weakness here is their cheesecake! My favorites include the original cheesecake, the fresh strawberry cheesecake, the tiramisu cheesecake... oh please! To be perfectly honest any cheesecake in front of me will be happily devoured. And the freshness, taste, and endless selection is what separates Cheesecake Factory from all the rest! 

In a way I am glad I'm usually here only once a year. Imagine if I was a regular? My waistline? C'mon plus no stairs to burn off the cheesecake calories?! Hmph! I'll be back again pressing that 8th floor elevator button...
author: Eric R.

description: Terrible sevice!! the server  gave me the wrong cake, and I asked the manager to change cake for me, and he said wait for a moment, actually he just did his own things, and I tried to ask him again, and he still ignored my request, he could just give me  immediately,  instead  let me wait about 30 minutes, in the end  the server finally willing to help me but  not the manager.
author: 昱儒

description: I ate here with my girl friends for my friends birthday and received impeccable service! our server was beyond kind his name is chazkey. Not sure on the spelling of the name, but he was super friendly!! My friends and I LOVED his service!!
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Our wait was close to 2 hours. It's a Saturday in SF what do you expect. 

There was a server change in between our service before we got our entree's because our guy was taking a 30. 

I never got my coke but that's okay because water is better for you I guess. 

They were out of the brown bread allegedly. We asked for more normal bread & never got it (there were 4 of us) 

It took quite a while for food to come out in the first place so we were starving.

Never got checked on, was not able to order drinks to make up for the long food wait because of that. 

This was supposed to be a medium mushroom burger. It clearly was not, server didn't check on us that much so I just ate it & it was soggy and disgusting.  (Picture below)

My friends didn't enjoy their entrees that much either, we took it all to go & ended up tossing it. 

Still tipped over 20% though. 

Disappointing way to celebrate my friends 23rd birthday to say the least
author: Shannon D.

description: This is a typical Cheesecake Factory right in the heart of Union Square. The outside view is amazing, but that's the only unique thing it has going for it. I came here on a Sunday with my siblings (3 of us total) at around 11am, and it was packed. Luckily, we were seated pretty quickly since we had such a small party. The food was alright, and the service was efficient, albeit a little slow, but considering that it was packed, I don't blame them. We were seated inside since it was a bit chilly outside, but whenever I would come here, we always try to sit outside, especially near the edge since you get a great view of Union Square. Overall, this is a typical Cheesecake Factory, with an amazing outside view!
author: Lisa C.

description:
In town and went to a familiar place. Got seated right away and requested an outdoor table. Nice day to be outside. Our server, Alexander, greeted us warmly and introduced himself. 

I got the special Thai coconut-lime chicken with white rice. Great tasty dish with mango, pea pods, red pepper for a bite, mushrooms and onions. Very tasty and lots of flavors. Would definitely get it again. 

Only down side was they leave on the stem end of the pea pods.
author: Barry A.

description:
Food was 0 star, literally 
Two star is for the ok service and nice views on the balcony...
author: XT H.

description:
My honest rating is a 2.5 star rather than a 3.0, mainly due to crazy wait times and substandard service.

This particular Cheesecake Factory location has the longest wait time or line of any Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to, most likely due to its location in Union Square. However, they do give you buzzers that will light up and ring once your table is ready. Be warned, the buzzer does not work if you wander too far away from the hostess area. I would highly recommend not going near a major meal time unless you are super ready to hunker down for a wait. 

Service here is either amazing or terrible. I've had attentive servers who are super nice on certain days then extremely rude, inattentive waitstaff on other days. This inconsistency really bothers me as bad service can turn any restaurant experience sour quite quickly.

One good thing about this Cheesecake Factory is that it is easy to access by various different modes of public transportation (BART, MUNI, bus). This particular location is also quite nice in terms of aesthetics. The outside views are great and the inside is clean and well decorated.

I'll always love the desserts and the avocado eggrolls at The Cheesecake Factory, but long lines and bad service really deter me from going there more often.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: The cheesecake factory has a really nice staff. The hostess was extremely welcoming and accommodating to our group of twelve. The servers also were very fast and cordial. Our group ordered various meals and each meal was really delicious. 4/5 experience simply for the wait getting the table. Other than that, everything else was great.
author: Tas T.

description:
Stopped in simply because we wanted to have dessert for dinner. Cheesecake is always a good choice and we happened to pass it, so stopped in.
The cheesecake was exactly as I remembered it - tasty. Our waiter was super nice and helpful.

As we're sitting their waiting for our cheesecake, we're looking around and remembering why we aren't huge fans. They seat too many tables for one waiter. None of the vacant tables I saw had complete place settings. We were sitting at a 4-top, two of the seats had a full place setting, minus the napkins and included dirty appetizer-sized plates. The other two place settings included dirty app-sized plates and a fork and a spoon, and those two settings had napkins. 

Decor.... seriously, I think that I've been to four different Cheesecake Factories and they all had the same decor. And we're talking YEARS in between the visits, my last one was in Scottsdale a couple of years ago. Before that was on the east coast easily 10+ years ago. I've never understood the decor. It's. Just. Boring.

Sure, they have terrific cheesecake. Go there for the cheesecake. Tip your waiter well if that's all you get. In most of these towns there are TONS of places with fantastic food..... try one of them for lunch/dinner instead.
author: Sharron G.

description:
Where do I start? I placed an order with Door Dash for some food and a great piece of cheesecake factory cheesecake, which I was looking forward to all day. I was told it would take, according to the system about an hour. And hour and 45 minutes later it finally arrived... The two entrées I ordered and no cheesecake! As I was able to reach the motorcycle delivery man, he said "Oh, I never got it...call the restaurant and they will send someone back with it".  So I called, was put on hold for 7 minutes; I hung up and asked again for someone to help me, and was put o hold another 7 minutes.  I called back a third time and was told there was only one person to handle the Door Dash orders.   I asked for a manager, and was told I would get taken care of right away.  7 minutes later I hung up.

I mainly wanted the cheesecake, but I got the shaft by both Door Dash, who have no one to fix a problem, and CF, who botched a customer interaction 3 times.   Shame!!!   

I know the CF founder, and he would blow a gasket over this kind of lamo attitude...beware!!!!!!!

The picture shows the order went in correct...
author: Eric B.

description:
Like any other Cheesecake Factory - great food and exceptional service. 

Located at the top of Macy's in San Francisco, you should definitely go here for the view. Just a few steps from the outdoor seating, the Macy's sign, visible from the hearts of San Fran, is situated. Overall, same memorable food with a great view. Enjoy!
author: Jasen O.

description:
Usually, things go well in the restaurant... but tonight (Friday night), the whole experience was a nightmare.

First, the waiting was too long (1h+ instead of the announced 50 min) and there was a mixup that delayed our table from being assigned to us... I had to go complain myself at the counter, otherwise we would have waited for much much longer.

Our waitress was kind to us and helpful but service was so so slow... hopefully, food was OK.

And finally, the most disappointing : they were out of cheesecakes for more than half of the proposed offerings ! How is that possible !?! Ain't this called the Cheesecake Factory !?!

Overall, we wanted to spend a special moment for our last night in SF with a treat. We got it, but the wrong kind :-(
author: Youssef B.

description:
SF'Finest! No other  factory compares  spectacular view, great menu, awesome service. Shop til you drop at Macy's.! But the best part is doing it with someone special and making amazing memories together and hopefully for a lifetime. We had so much fun it was such a beautiful fabulous day my heart is filled with so much joy especially when you have lifetime memories with the lve of your life.

SFC WAY!
GINA AND AQ
author: Gina M.

description:
I totally get why you only average 3 stars you have zero focus on service! I arrived told 20 min wait. Got pager waited in the bar. While waiting I noticed at least 10 2 tops open. 15 min Later a seat opened at the bar. I ordered a small salad and chicken Marcella. After 40 min nothing arrived, I asked bartender and he said its coming. Also again asked about bread said it was coming also another 10 min goes by now here for 50 min and a manager stops by to say sorry salad is taking so long we ran out of croutons. I said I'm good without croutons brought salad he asked if I wanted cracked pepper I said yes. Never cam back! I was out of tea food I could eat at one hour I gave up! Asked for a manager got same manger who did not bring pepper and he said sorry and walked off! Seriously guys service remember what that is? Never again Cheesecake Factory I guess you just want tourists ! 

Oh one more thing in the hour and 10 minutes I was at Cheesecake my pager never went off and the tables the two top by the bar were never seated empty the whole time I was there! When I asked about it as I left she told me she could not find me in system! Really?
author: Brian B.

description: The flies are disgusting in the rotunda shaped room. Wait staff seems unconcerned about the health issue in Birmingham, AL
author: Karen N.

description: I have been to the cheesecake factory a bunch of times in the past but, today was probably one of the worst dining experiences I ever had in any restaurant.  It took about 50 minutes for us to get the food, and we ordered 2 apps, a kids grilled chicken and fries, and a stake medium with vegetables.  None of the above that would take long to cook.  When the meal finally arrived, the stake was well done and dry, and there was only a little bit of asparagus on the plate.  The waitress took the stake and I had to wait for them to cook another one.  The second stake came out raw and chewy.  Finally the manager came and I showed her the stake.  She apologized and asked if I wanted something else.  I told her just to bring chicken and broccoli.  The waitress came back with two small pieces of chicken.  I ended up leaving unsatisfied with the service.  I don't think I'll go back there again.
author: Julio M.

description:
Walked up to get a table for (3). There were (5) employees behind the counter and not one made eye contact or acknowledged our presence for at least (2) minutes. Even once we were acknowledged the lady was not very friendly. So, we were off to a rude start. 

Once seated, it took about (5) minutes for someone to acknowledge us and take our drink orders. Once that was done, it took another (5-10) minutes to actually get said drinks. 

We finally ordered and we got a burger, veggie burger and flat bread. Nothing wow'd any of us. 

The food and service are much to be desired. Bottom line is, due to the location, they clearly don't care about customer service because they don't have to.  The totality of this experience is one reason I don't eat at chain restaurants often.
author: Sheryl M.

description: First time at he Cheesecake Factory ! The food and service were great. Went here after on a busy Sunday after SF pride on 6/24 and enjoyed the honey truffle chicken !
author: Alicia P.

description: The food there was great and the waitresses were good also. However, it was not a good experience to have dinner there because the bad attitude of the front desk host. I could not remember his name but he was with brown or black hair. He yelled to me and said "oh my god, I cannot hear your voice". I understood the restaurant was busy and it is difficult to hear clearly with low volume but I am a little bit concerned if a well-trained and professional host should say it or not.
author: Tzu-Heng C.

description: Wow this is the worse place to go to ever!!!!!! I sat out side they didn't warn us on how chilli it was gonna get. The server wasn't even nice from the get go! When we asked to change our seats inside she got upset, we said we know it's an inconvenience but it's was making our food experience miserable. She then told us after we left the table that are food was ready after waiting over an hour. She basically said that if our food was cold it was are prob. Then we talk to the manger MIke and he did not care at all. We told him that we would pay for our drinks and leave. He didn't care at all and when I asked him why he didn't care he said nothing. We paid 30 for to drinks. When he gave us the check back he also gave us the wrong change and tried to short us $10. Don't come here worse customer service ever. Warning your better off with anything other than this.
author: Abbie K.

description:
Raw chicken!! Completely unacceptable by any means. Clearly this means the kitchen staff was rushed to get food out with no supervision by the kitchen management.

Sloppy, sloppy food preparation practices. This place should be avoided unless you feel like taking a chance at catching salmonella poisoning.
author: ßenjämin Ä.

description: This is one of a handful of reviews I have done, but I am taking the time to write this due to a piece of plastic being found in my toddlers fruit. The manager was of no help, and provided no assurances that this wouldn't happen in the future. She was unapologetic and instead told us how the piece of plastic, which I had to pull out of my sons mouth, may have gotten in the fruit. He was near the point of choking. I hope the manager told the chef, or will implement some preventative measures.
author: Sara F.

description:
Cheesecake factory is our guilty pleasure as a family. We really enjoy the service and the overall quality of the food. Specially the fact that they serve a lot of gluten free dishes.

My wife usually orders de Basil pasta with gluten free option because it's cooked really well however today the dish had a couple of non gluten free noodles. It was no biggie, she was able to keep eating but she mentioned it to the waiter just in case they were mixing it up

Needless to say, the manager came to check if my wife was feeling bad. I really appreciated this
author: Daniel C.

description:
Off the bat, we were seated promptly which was very nice on a holiday (Christmas Eve). It took only 10 minutes for a table of 6 since we got here at 11:00 am

However, we were waiting for 25-30 minutes for a server and we decided to ask one of the nearby servers about where our server was and he was very nice and talked to the manager for us. So we waited for another 5 minutes and still there was no show. So we talked to a hostess and she told us she couldn't talk and shooed is away. 

So the manager came over and brought another server for us, Josh. The manager explained that our server was stuck at the airport. If your server was not here, shouldn't you know about it and not put people in their section? 

When it hit an hour and we still did not have our food in front of us, we talked to a hostess and she was very nice in helping us getting our food, the food arrived in 2 minutes after that. 

The server kept running away after finishing whatever he needed at our table. Seemed like he was intimidated by us. We couldn't even ask him for a refill on our drink.

The food was good so that's how they still get 2 stars, but was it worth the hour wait? No.
author: Cyrena L.

description:
Very very bad Management
we waited for more than 100 mins (6000 secs) for a party of 8 to get the table.
Manager was David and he told us we will get the table in 90 mins, we patiently waited but never got any response from cheesecake staff of how long will it take..
People come to cheesecake for good food but there MAN and TIME management needs a lot of improvement

I wish they can be more predictable about the wait times or atleast have some courtsey to appreciate our time.
author: Jalpa P.

description:
Story time!!!!!!! 

 I was so angry about this it took me long time to post it. 

So I ordered food to-go for my family for a birthday gathering at the house. The birthday girl wanted the Bang bang chicken and shrimp so I go all the was to Pleasanton location and took home to Oakland to have for dinner. Easy enough right?!?!

Especially because we all ordered the same thing (bang bang chicken and shrimp) trying to keep it simple. But of course when I go ALL THE WAY HOME I open the bags and it was everything BUT what we ordered.

So I call and explain what happened and do you know what they tell me ?? 

"YOU should have OPEND SINGLE EVERYONE and made sure it was correct.... " although on the recite I was changed for the same thing every order and it matched the one on the bag that's the employee gave me.

Fun fact: I DONT WORK AT CHEESECAKE FACTORY AND ITS NOT MY JOB  TO CHECK THE BAG !

I let them know that the part of Oakland I live in is almost all the was to Berkeley so this drive is almost 50 mins with no traffic! I told the manger I would like a refund and  for them to make new food because of all the trouble and the drive he AGREED OVER THE PHONE TO COMP THE FOOD. 

mind you at this point it's 8pm when I finely walk back through the doors of cheesecake and her birthday party has no food. ( they really destroyed this day up for my family) THEN HE SAID HE WONT COMP. THE FOOD. even after everything that happened and saying he would over the phone!!!! I had to drive all the way back from Oakland 50 min both ways twice in one day! He said he could only give us free cheesecake....WTF IM I SUPPOSED TO DO WITH FREE CHEESECAKE AT A BIRTHDAY PARTY? there's already cake DUH!  I just wanted what he agreed to on the phone. And to be compensated for their mistake.  ( but I took ALL the "free cake " and promptly threw it ALL away right there in there trash to prove a point ) 

 OOOh and here's the kicker the food was not even ready when I got there although I called when I was 20mins away just to make sure they were remaking it and was TOLD YES. Yet I still had to sit there for an hour for the food!  needless to say the birthday party was ruined and I did get back home with the food until 10pm. 

Bottom line: THEY CAN KIND KISS MY ENTIRE BLACK .....
author: Arianna T.

description:
This location used to be nice for ambiance, atmosphere, and location, however as it ages over time, it has become less and less enticing. The interior has an old mop or bar smell which is quite disturbing. Honestly, go to the other locations if you can. 

Decided to come here again to try it out as we were in the area for lunch. Wait was pretty short however, the server seemed to be bored of his job. Didn't bother to introduce himself, didn't ask for beverages at all, just asked what we wanted to order, and when I mentioned I needed a bit more time, he just seemed annoyed.

Everything here was just... old. The water cups were disturbing, the plastic has become yellow due to age, and there were visible cracks near the top of the cup where people drink from. Cracks in anything is a source for bacteria to grow and extremely unsanitary. If you're putting yourself out as a full service restaurant that's supposed to be somewhat fancier than a local take out spot, at least use glass cups... 

Wait for food was over 30 minutes. The place wasn't even packed. The tables around us also waited similar amounts. 

Asked for wheat only bread, server brought both types. Asked for no cheese on the salad. Salad still came with cheese. 

Was seated in the patio. Waiters didn't bother cleaning up the tables after patrons had left and tons of birds swooped down and started having a feast. Happened at multiple vacant tables.
author: Scott K.

description: The food is pretty good just like any other Cheesecake Factory but the service is shit. They are super slow and forget things that you ask for many times. My mom and me just ate here a little while ago. We specifically asked to be seated inside because we would be too cold outside. Unfortunately for us we were sat in a section right next to a door that was wide open and the cold wind was coming in so we were freezing. We asked the manager to close it but he said he couldn't so we asked to be seated in a different section and he said that he would see what he could do but of course didn't do anything, so we were freezing the whole time we trying to enjoy lunch. The hostess that checks people in is also super rude and always has a horrible attitude. All in all the service is pretty terrible.
author: Delia K.

description: Just came in for drinks.Now we come like ones a month for the drinks food and the view. The view outside is so nice you get to see all union square.
author: Armando S.

description: On hold for 15 min in hopes to put in a to-go order. Called back to speak to someone else and was placed on hold again.  The hostess I spoke to mentioned that she was unable to take my order and that someone from the bakery would be able to assist me. However after another 8 min or so of waiting, I eventually hung up.  -_- Come ooooon.
author: Jann B.

description:
3.5 Stars

The beau accused me of only liking hipster places but sometimes I'm hip to the Midwest eateries too ;)

Came here while killing time waiting for our skating session at the Union Square Rink. I haven't eaten here in years because I'm not big on chain restaurants (chipotle, chick-fil-a and super duper excluded) and quantity over quality.

We had buffalo blasts to start (think buffalo chicken samosas) and then I had the chicken bellagio while beau had the chicken and biscuits. Ambient bread came out to start the meal. Bread was just okay--ate it because it was there. Portions are HUGE! We ate all of the app and then were totally conquered by our entrees.

We got about 4 meals with leftovers so you can't beat the value here. In terms of the food--meh. Definitely average to slightly above average. It's a chain and food didn't exactly challenge my palette but it's perfectly fine for a place that has a bit of everything. Menu is slightly overwhelming and if you somehow saved room for dessert, there are two pages of cheesecake to choose from.

All in all I guess I'm not gonna turn my nose up at this place. It's perfectly fine! Won't find any reclaimed wood, mustached waiters or mason jars for glasses here but it's a good place to get a meal in the area and views are nice. Wait on a Sunday at 4 was an hour but they text you once the table is ready.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Tip begging? Disgusting. "Benaster J" really made us uncomfortable. I come to cheesecake all of the time but it's about time that we find somewhere else to come weekly.
author: Sierra W.

description:
Amazing cheesecake, absolutely tasty and delicious...but next time I will stick with it and bring it home. 
Unfortunately the service was unbelievably slow.
It took over 25 minuets to be seated, other good 15 minutes just to place the order and forever to finally receive the food!
By the way, one of the forks that we found on the table was very dirty, some crusted food on it.
Food was just not meeting our expectations:
Fish and chips was totally bland, pizza was salty and super hard ( I'm sure it was re-heated at least once) chicken sandwich was dry and the amount of chicken inside was ridiculously small...
Thumbs up for their burrito which was just ok and the mushroom burger, pretty tasty.
Said that, considering the price of the food (in my opinion overpriced for what you get) and the terrible service,we absolutely will not ever eat here again.
Still, let me say that their cheesecake is always super good, no matter which one you order, you will never be disappointed.
author: Michelle C.

description:
My daughter and I visited this location in December 2017. It's in the Macy's building on the top floor, so we had a view.

I ordered chicken taquitos as my starter, and my meal was shrimp scampi with mashed potatoes. Oh, how sensational the flavors were!!

I enjoyed my meal and would visit this place again.

The only gripe I have is the parking was across the street, and they DON'T validate your ticket (even if you've eaten in their restaurant). I think that should change.
author: Nicole H.

description: OMG! Don't go here on a Sunday if you want fast service. There were literally almost no people there today and our food took 45 minutes(there were only two of us and I got a salad). This is the second time in the last month this has happened to us. I won't go back on a weekend for a long long time.
author: Kelly S.

description: Service was great. But the food was just decent. Wait time was a bit overwhelming. The cheesecakes are of corse on point though!
author: Sam V.

description: They were out of the macaroni for the macaroni burger. After I chose an alternative, they came out with the wrong order. Took even more time out of my date and my date's food became cold.
author: Jose F.

description: Amazing! From the Mac n Cheese Veggie Burger to the Salmon & Mashed Potatoes - excellent! And our waitress was the best I have experienced  in a very long time.
author: Dee H.

description: This was inside the building of Macy's, catch an elevator up! We arrived around 8pm and there was a 30min wait, we enjoyed the high view of the city during our wait time. We ordered the banana cheese cake and the Godiva cheese cake, the Godiva cheese cake was really rich in chocolate, the plate cake decorated with whipped cream but you didn't need that to compliment your cheesecake! Atmosphere during that time was loud as it was so popular with people swarming in!
author: Shan N.

description: My wife left her purse after dinner. Homes staff saved it for us without anything going missing. Thank you guys. The food was good too.
author: Seth C.

description:
We were all hungry after checking out my sister's Academy of Arts Pre-College summer program exhibit. Out of all the places to savor my little sister chose the Cheesecake Factory. 

I would recommend parking in a garage (prices range from different businesses) and walking to this location or taking the bart. Parking on the streets in the city can be hard to find. Go exploring after to get your money's worth! 

This restaurant is located inside Macy's right where Union Square is. On a Saturday around 1 pm we waited 30 minutes for our outdoor table. Keep in mind you are in San Francisco and in the middle of an endless shopping area. It wasn't a surprise there was a wait. One of the wonderful things that I love about going to the city is listening to the background of tourists who are ecstatic to be here in San Francisco :). It makes waiting more entertaining! 

I appreciated the fact that our waiters were still attentive and would ask us if we needed anything else throughout our lunch despite it being busy. Great customer service! Also the dining place itself was very clean and tables were immediately bused when customers left.

At chains like the Cheesecake Factory, I tend to order what I know is good and stick with it. 

What I recommend:

Americana Cheeseburger ($13.95) - This burger consists of American/cheddar cheese, crunchy potato crisps, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, pickles, and secret sauce. A moist burger with ingredients that may seem basic, but coexist to leave you deliciously satisfied until the last mouthful. I find that this entree can be lovingly shared between two people. 

Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheesecake- Ever find yourself thinking that your eating cake when your at the Cheesecake Factory? This one is a CLOUD in your mouth compared to some of the flavors that are offered on the menu. The caramel cheesecake isn't taxingly sweet. The caramel mousse and vanilla crust only enhances this simple recipe without overwhelming you and your stomach!

Overall this place makes me a pleased customer!
I would come back here for a future lunch or dinner.
author: Suzette C.

description:
We're been here several times, but there seems to be a definite change in management.  It's the attention to details,
that disappointed us most.  We had to eat our meal next to a very large pitbull that was clearly not a service animal.  We requested another table but was told there was none available in an off-peak time.  It made for a very unpleasant dining experience for us.  In addition the dog owner paraded around the restaurant with no interference from the staff.  Not sure if I would recommend the cheesecake factory on Union Square in San Francisco.
author: Sherri M.

description: Food is about a 4, but in San Francisco where there are so many selections, it's a 3.  Cheesecake is why I go there, but slices are getting smaller.  View is the best part, the wait not so great.
author: Gregory N.

description:
So, I ventured into The City to meet Vango/Mom for Mother's Day. This location,one has to enter through the Macy's. The entrance is on the Union Square side of Macy's. Then one takes the elevator to the eight floor to arrive at Cheesecake Factory. This was a rather ideal time.

They opened at 9am yesterday, my mom and I arrived shortly after that. We were seated right away. I wasn't quite sure if they have a Brunch menu, but it turns out that they do. I decided upon ordering the French Toast, and my mom chose to have an Egg White Omlette. Jackie was our server in the beginning, she did a fantastic job, and sadly she had to take a brake, and pass us of to Joanne, she was great to.

When my French Toast arrived, it was a wonderful presentation. It looks like they use French Bread here. It was served sprinkled with powered sugar, and small amount of diced strawberries on top. Yes, I took a picture, and will include that. It was getting pretty busy because of Mother's Day. This location also has outside seating, my mom and I dined inside. we had just the right amount of food to eat. This location is a reasonable walk from Powell Street Bart.

Edgar, yes, I said "Hi" to Edgar. The water is a little tricky, you have to stand in just the right place. Overall, I'd have to say that it was a satisfying experience.
author: Peter J.

description: Excellent food and view. A nice way to get rid off the SF madness (labor days ), and have quality time
author: Pablo S.

description: This place sucks!! Waited an hour and a half for a table. Time quoted was an hour! We have 8 people in a bachelorette party and waited an additional 30-45 minutes after our table pager buzzed!! Super dissatisfied with the service! Quote correct time waiting at least! Our bride was ready for bed the time dinner was served!!:(:(
author: Brittany T.

description: This is just an amazing place from my experience working here the food is amazing. Food is prepared by the best and qualified! I recommend this place twice to all my good friends and family. Mango key lime cheesecake is the best desert item on the menu in my opinion
author: Pate' B.

description:
I've been coming here for many years and always liked it. Not high gastronomy for sure but many good things:

-beautiful roof terrasse over Macy's with a lovely Union Square view. 
-Great cheesecakes, dozens flavours to choose from
-great healthy menu available 
-nice waiters/hostesses 
-fair prices
-great lunch deals

I love the pumpkin cheesecake. They now also have a red velvet one but haven't tried it yet.
author: Fa R.

description: Zero stars should be an option. The service was incredibly poor from the start. Our pager buzzed fairly quickly but when we handed it over we were told to wait for our name on the side. One party was called. Then the next. Then the next. And so on until I finally got the attention of someone to take us to our table. Finally we're sat and we wait again. No one checks in for about 15 mins and we finally get our orders taken. The drinks come out in a decent amount of time and then the waiting ensues yet again. We literally waited about 35 minutes for our food and in that time they never checked in on us. No apology for the wait and my order was wrong but I wasn't about to send it back to wait 35 more minutes. And it wasn't like I could tell them because they didn't check in again until we needed boxes to go. We handed over a card to pay without seeing the check because we didn't want to risk waiting any longer and that receipt sure made it back to us quickly. Probably the quickest service we had all night in this place. We were celebrating a birthday and trying to make it special but the service was severely lacking. I noticed that our waiter did walk by a few times while we had our food and didn't even look our way. Were we that much of burden? I really try to give people the benefit of the doubt, especially in the service industry but the inattentiveness was too much. A simple check in to let us know food was on the way or ask how things were going or just an apology for all the waiting would have made all the difference! But we couldn't even get that. I do not recommend this location solely on the poor service.
author: Kiana A.

description: I absolutely love coming to Cheesecake Factory. Whether it's where I live or where I travel to, the Cheesecake Factory is a great restaurant. There is always a wait but it shouldn't be anything longer than 30 min or so. The staff is always friendly and the food is always delicious. If you come, you MUST have a cheesecake or otherwise you missed out on The Cheesecake Factory.
author: Jon S.

description: It was really good! Straight fire both times I've been there. Me and my company had excellent meal. I ordered a delicious chicken meal and some cheesecake. Lil mama got a pasta dish and she loved it. The service was excellent. We ate a massive amount of bread and I'm obsessed with ice water. Your ice water was choice, if I must say. Haha good job team
author: Jeff Y.

description: Literally everything is delicious, from the pizzas to the salads all the tastes are really, really good. You can not go there without trying one of their cheesecakes! They are out of this world.
author: Diego M.

description: Many of my friends recommanded this restaurant, so I was really excited to try. We had waited in line for almost an hour, even on Monday afternoon. We had ordered 2 flavor of cheesecake which were lemon and chocolate.  But after one bite of a cheesecake, it became too rich. I think it was too sweet that made the cake became rich and made me feel full. The price here is not expensive, but I will try another cheesecake store for instead. This won't be my priority choices.
author: 珮瑜

description: The food is delicious but prices too high. You can goo for happy hours. They have some deals
author: Moti S.

description: One star for rude and lazy service! I went here with my boyfriend for my birthday on November 28th, 2017. Its my literal birthday. We get seated pretty quickly out on the balcony. However, it took almost 10 minutes for someone to finally wait our table. Since we had so much time to review the menu we were ready to order apps, entrees, and drinks. My bf NEVER drinks but wanted to celebrate my birthday so I was very excited to put in alcoholic drink orders. As we're on the balcony there are two other birthdays nearby and these people are sung to and offered cheesecake with a candle. App comes... entree comes... No drinks! At this point it was too late. When the server finally returns well after we're done eating everything, my bf mentions the drinks and cancels them. The server is apologetic and puts her hand on my shoulder, regretfully stating "omg... I'm ruining your birthday!" I told her it was okay and my boyfriend playfully hints that a complimentary cheesecake would make up for it (which I should get anyway since its my bday)... after another 10 or 15 minutes goes by, I pass our server while going to the restroom and I hear her putting an order into the dessert desk up front. Upon my return, she walks up a few minutes later with a singular crescent-shaped melted scoop of vanilla ice cream with a sad dollop of whipped cream and lazy sprinkles thrown on with an unlit bday candle ontop.
